title: Podcast & Brand Operations Specialist (Virtual Assistant)
description:
We're looking for a sharp, organized, and positive person who loves helping things run smoothly and wants to grow with a fast-moving media brand. If you're detail-oriented, proactive, take feedback well, and enjoy supporting creators who are making a real impact in agriculture this could be a great long-term role.



You'll be a key part of our small, family-run team, handling day-to-day operations so we can focus on creating great content.



Who We Are: TDF Media is the home of Barn Talk: the largest agriculture podcast in the world, and This'll Do Farm YouTube channel. We're a father-son operation based on our family farm in Iowa, sharing real rural stories, hot topics, farming know-how, and honest conversations that resonate with farmers and rural folks everywhere. We're growing fast (hundreds of thousands of listeners/viewers, paid speaking gigs, and more pillars coming) and passionate about building an authentic media brand that supports American agriculture.



If you love podcasts, YouTube, or farming content — and want to be part of a supportive team where your contributions matter we'd love to meet you.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES



Guest Outreach & Scheduling

- Research and reach out to potential podcast guests (ag experts, farmers, industry leaders)

- Schedule interviews and pre-interview calls

- Maintain guest pipeline and calendar



Community Engagement

- Respond to comments on YouTube videos (both channels)

- Monitor and reply to DMs/inquiries on social media

- Help build positive community vibe



 Inbox Management

- Manage and organize inboxes for Barn Talk and This'll Do Farm

- Filter, respond to, or flag important
s (fan messages, sponsor inquiries, etc.)



YouTube Content Posting

- Upload full-length podcast episodes and farm videos to YouTube

- Create simple thumbnails (we'll train you in Canva)

- Write optimized titles, descriptions, and tags

- Schedule posts and monitor performance



General Support

- Miscellaneous admin tasks to support the team (research, data entry, etc.)

- Opportunity to take on more as you grow (social clips, basic editing, etc.)



SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

- Extremely organized with strong attention to detail

- Excellent written and spoken English

- Proactive, fast learner who takes initiative

- Comfortable with Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Calendar), Slack, Canva

- Bonus: Experience with YouTube, podcasts, or social media management

- Bonus: Interest in agriculture, farming, or rural lifestyle content

- Reliable internet and quiet workspace for occasional calls



INSTRUCTIONS TO APPLY

To apply, please record a short video (3-5 minutes total) answering these four questions:



- Tell us about yourself — what do you love to do, and what excites you?

- Share your past work experience and how it relates to this role at TDF Media.

- Why do you think you'd be a great fit for supporting an agriculture podcast and farm YouTube channel?

- Do you have any experience with podcasts, YouTube, guest outreach, community management, or admin tasks?



Upload your video to YouTube (unlisted is fine) or Google Drive and
 the link to:

title: Course Production Specialist — Full Time (Remote)
description:
Course Production Specialist — Full Time (Remote)



$1,300/month | 40 hours/week



We build complete online course businesses for coaches and consultants — courses, 7-day challenges, launch sequences, and ongoing marketing. All done for them. We're scaling and need someone who can own the production and quality of what we deliver.



This is not a button-clicking role.



Yes, you'll have video SOPs for every task. But we need someone who understands WHY we do things, not just HOW. You'll be running pre-made AI automations, building course portals, setting up
 sequences, and producing launch assets—but you'll also be quality-checking everything before it reaches a paying client. That means you need to actually know what good looks like.



If you can't tell the difference between a weak subject line and a strong one, if you can't spot when a course module is out of order, if you read "I facilitate transformational journeys that empower individuals to unlock their authentic potential" and don't immediately want to rewrite it — this isn't the role for you.



What you'll be doing:



- Running AI automations and quality checking the outputs before they go anywhere

- Building course portals from templates and adapting them per client

- Reviewing course scripts and curricula for logical flow, engagement, and clarity

- Reviewing sales copy,
 sequences, and landing page content for persuasion and tone

- Setting up
 sequences and launch assets

- Formatting slides, workbooks, quizzes, and supplementary materials

- Managing multiple client projects simultaneously without dropping balls

- Flagging problems before they reach the client — not after



What you need:



- Genuine understanding of online course structure — you know what makes a course flow well and what makes students drop off

- Copywriting awareness — you can spot a weak CTA, a boring subject line, or a sales
 that doesn't convert

-
 marketing knowledge — you understand how a nurture sequence differs from a launch sequence and why
 4 does something different to
 7

- Familiarity with the coaching and consulting space — you understand how coaches sell, who their audiences are, and what transformation-based language looks like

- Problem-solving instinct — when something breaks, you try to fix it before asking for help. If you're stuck after 15 minutes, you flag it with what you've already tried

- Tech comfortable — Google Drive, course platforms,
 tools, project management software, AI tools. You don't need to know them all but you need to learn fast without hand-holding

- Strong English — you're reading and reviewing client-facing content. Grammar, tone, and clarity matter

- Available during UK business hours, preference for 4am-12pm UK overlap

- Reliable — deadlines matter and if you say it's done, it's done properly





What makes this different:



- Full video training for every task — but we trust you to think beyond them

- If you find a better way to do something, we want to hear it

- Your work goes directly to paying clients — you'll see the impact immediately

- Growth path into team lead or production manager as we scale



To apply:



Fill out this form: 



Do not apply via OnlineJobs.ph message. Applications not submitted through the form will not be reviewed.



The form includes practical questions. We use these to assess your actual ability, not just your CV. Take your time with them and don't use AI to write your answers — we will know.

title: SEO Assistant – $5/hour to Start (Remote, Long-Term, Growth Opportunity)

? This Role Is NOT For You If:

???? Compensation & Structure

Potential to grow into project-based or fixed-scope contracts based on trust and performance



Bonuses for consistent, high-quality output



No cap on upside for people who take ownership and deliver

You check Slack at least 2–3x per week



You hit deadlines and update proactively



You ask smart questions, offer suggestions, and care about results



You will work across multiple sites, niches, and campaign types

:

ex: SEO Assistant - ($1M Sales Driven)

Tools you’ve used (SEO, audit, research, content, etc.)

 (Free version is

title: Social Media Manager + Video Editor (Personal Brand | Leadership Coaching | PST Hours)
description:
Are you the kind of social media manager who doesn’t just post content…

but turns raw footage into viral, scroll-stopping content?



Do you understand how to repurpose one video into 10 high-performing assets across Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok, and YouTube?



If yes — keep reading.



L’EVATE is hiring on behalf of a high-level U.S.-based leadership & executive coaching brand (client name confidential).



This is not a beginner role.



We are looking for someone who:



• Manages a full content calendar independently

• Has strong, modern video editing skills

• Understands short-form viral content strategy

• Knows how to tailor content per platform

• Tracks analytics and improves performance monthly



The client is based in California, so you must be able to overlap with PST hours.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

Content Strategy & Calendar

- Plan and manage weekly/monthly content calendar

- Repurpose long-form video into short-form clips

- Align content with brand voice (professional, empowering, leadership-focused)

- Coordinate posting schedule across all platforms



Video Editing (This Is Critical)

Turn raw coaching footage into:

- Reels, TikToks, YouTube Shorts, LinkedIn clips



Add:

- Engaging captions

- Dynamic cuts

- Hooks in first 3 seconds

- Motion graphics

- Clean subtitles

- Trending audio (when relevant)

- Understand pacing, retention, and storytelling



You should know how to make content that:

- Feels native to each platform

- Has viral potential

- Stops the scroll



Platform Management

- Instagram (Reels, carousels, stories)

- LinkedIn (thought leadership posts + video)

- TikTok

- YouTube (Shorts + long-form optimization)



Analytics & Growth

- Track KPIs monthly:

- Views

- Watch time

- Engagement rate

- Saves/shares

- Follower growth

- Recommend strategy improvements

- Identify top-performing formats and double down



We’re Looking For Someone Who:



? Has 3+ years managing personal brands or coaching brands

? Has advanced video editing skills (CapCut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or similar)

? Understands hooks, retention, and viral structure

? Is strategic, not just task-based

? Can work independently and take ownership

? Can overlap at least 3–4 hours during PST

? Has strong English communication



Bonus if you:

- Have worked with coaches, speakers, or consultants

- Understand LinkedIn growth strategy

- Can suggest content ideas proactively



HOW TO APPLY - Those who don't follow these instructions will not be considered

Subject line: SOCIAL VIRAL PRO - {Your Name}

Must include the following:

1. Updated Resume

2. Portfolio of accounts you’ve managed

3. short form video samples you've edited

4. Links to social media pages you’ve grown

5. What makes you the best candidate for the role?

description:

Job Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled Structural Engineer / Revit Modeler to join our team. This role focuses on designing and detailing multi-level storage buildings, which require a unique structural approach due to their heavy load-bearing systems and specialized construction methods.

The ideal candidate is not only a strong structural engineer but also a super expert in Revit modeling, capable of creating precise, complex models with minimal supervision.

Maintain accuracy and consistency across all Revit models and related documentation.

Coordinate with project managers and other disciplines to ensure seamless project delivery.

Bachelor’s degree in Structural Engineering, Civil Engineering, or related field.

Industrial and commercial engineering experience preferred, particularly with heavy load-bearing structures.

Proven expertise as a Revit Modeler, with advanced knowledge of large-scale modeling.

Strong understanding of structural systems, especially for multi-level and heavy storage buildings.

Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication and collaboration abilities in a remote team environment.



Preferred Skills:

Experience with Steel Structures, Concrete Structures, Masonry Construction, Light and Gauge Steel Structures

title: Property Maintenance & Construction Coordinator
description:
******TO BE CONSIDERED AS AN APPLICANT, PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR MOST UP-TO-DATE RESUME AND A VIDEO INTRODUCTION TAILORED TO THIS JOB POSTING!****** 



Property Maintenance & Construction Coordinator



Job Type: Full-Time

Work Hours: Monday to Friday, 7:00 AM to 3:30 PM Pacific Time, with a 30-minute break

Salary: $1,000 per month



Job Overview: 

We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Property Maintenance & Construction Coordinator to manage maintenance requests, construction scheduling, unit turnovers, and inspections across a residential property portfolio. This role plays a key part in ensuring repairs, renovations, and inspections are completed efficiently and on schedule by coordinating with vendors, tenants, and internal stakeholders.



Key Responsibilities:



Maintenance Coordination

Schedule all maintenance work orders with vendors and tenants

Answer maintenance calls and create work orders as needed

Follow up with vendors to confirm repairs are completed properly and on time

Track maintenance requests and ensure timely resolution



Construction & Renovation

Send construction plans to vendors for proposals and bids

Schedule and coordinate trades throughout each project

Monitor project timelines and assist with Certificate of Occupancy clearances



Vacancy & Turnovers

Schedule vacancy remodels and unit turns with vendors

Conduct daily follow-ups to ensure vacant units are completed on schedule

Coordinate closely with vendors to minimize vacancy downtime

Inspections & Compliance

Review inspection reports from banks, insurance providers, housing departments, and Section 8

Create work orders based on inspection findings

Schedule and track required repairs to ensure compliance



Required Skills & Qualifications:

Experience in property management, maintenance coordination, or construction scheduling

Strong organizational and time-management skills with the ability to manage multiple work orders and projects simultaneously

Excellent communication skills for coordinating with vendors, tenants, and internal stakeholders

Familiarity with property inspections, repairs, and vendor coordination

Working knowledge of inspection processes (bank, insurance, housing department, and Section 8)

Experience working with residential or multifamily properties

Experience using property management or work order systems

Ability to work independently, follow up proactively, and ensure tasks are completed on time



Note: An NBI or police clearance will be required upon acceptance of the job offer.

This is not full-time or part-time work. It’s gig work. When a project comes in, I’ll reach out, confirm availability, agree on scope and pricing, and then get it built.

Home

About Us

Services

Contact

title: IT Support Specialist
description:
We're a technical support company based in the US, looking to hire an IT specialist to support customers with computer, network,
, and other issues. 



This job is during US business hours (NYC time). When a customer reaches out, you have to be ready to respond and hop on a call with them to fix their issue within 5 minutes. 



We're looking for someone with at least two years of experience doing IT support. 



Good, friendly customer service is a must. 



IMPORTANT: Perfect English is a must. We will only accept people with excellent English and little to no accent (even if you are highly experienced). DON'T apply for this job if you don't sound like an American.



We expect you to be available during US business hours. You are free to do other things when you are not working with a customer; however, you will be expected to be able to stop whatever you are doing and connect with the customer within 5 minutes of them requesting help. 



Payment is based on how many jobs you take and what type of jobs. You can expect to make between $25-$30 USD per hour of work on average. The more jobs you take and the better you do, the more we will give you. You can expect to be making around $200/day within 3 months.

title: Marketing Assistant - Long-Term Growth Opportunity
description:
About The Role

We're a US-based digital marketing agency looking for a reliable marketing assistant to grow with us long-term. This role starts with directory listing management (simple content updates on Wordpress), Canva work in a template and social posting. The role then grows into
 campaigns, CRM management (GHL), and more complex marketing tasks as you prove yourself.

We're a faith-based family business that values honesty, clear communication, and long-term relationships over quick results.

What You'll Be Doing



Primary Tasks:



Creating and managing online directory listings (high-volume daily work)

Publishing content on Wordpress

Basic WordPress updates and maintenance

Creating simple graphics in Canva

Task tracking in ClickUp and time tracking in Clockify

Basic GoHighLevel (CRM) tasks for social media





As You Grow:



More complex
 marketing campaigns

Advanced GoHighLevel CRM management

Social media content support

Client communication assistance

Marketing campaign coordination



Required Skills

Must Have:



ClickUp experience (or similar project management tool)

WordPress experience (publishing posts, basic updates)

Canva experience

Strong written English

Reliable internet with backup plan

Own computer/equipment

Comfortable with time tracking tools



Preferred:



GoHighLevel (CRM) experience

Instantly or other
 marketing platform experience

Experience working with US-based clients

Marketing agency background



What We Need Most

We had a previous VA who overstated abilities and disappeared when questions came up. We need the opposite:

? Asks questions when unsure (before making mistakes)

? Communicates clearly and proactively

? Admits what they don't know

? Follows through consistently

? Treats this as a real career opportunity, not a short-term gig



We'll train you. We need reliability and honesty first, skills second.



15-20 hours per week to start

Room to grow to 30-40 hours/week



Payment:



Weekly via Wise or Remitly

All hours tracked in Clockify

Tasks managed in ClickUp



Growth Opportunity:



Raises as you take on more responsibility

Performance bonuses available

Path to full-time role



Please answer ALL questions below. Generic or incomplete answers will not be considered.



1. **Tool Experience - Be Honest:**

Rate your ACTUAL experience with each tool (we'll train you, honesty and ability to learn matters more than expertise):

   - ClickUp: (Never used / Used a few times / Use regularly / Expert)

   - WordPress: (Never used / Used a few times / Use regularly / Expert)

   - GoHighLevel: (Never used / Used a few times / Use regularly / Expert)

   - Instantly: (Never used / Basic / Intermediate / Advanced)

   - Clockify: (Never used / Used a few times / Use regularly / Expert)



2. **Communication Test:**

Imagine this scenario: I assign you a task to create 10 directory listings using a template. You create the first one, but realize the template is missing some information you need to complete it. What do you do? (Be specific about your exact steps)



3. **Learning & Problem-Solving:**

Describe a specific time you were asked to use a tool or platform you'd never used before. What was it? How did you learn it? How long did it take? What resources did you use?



4. **Work Style:**

Our previous VA would go silent for days when they hit problems or didn't know something. Why do YOU think clear communication matters in remote work? (Give a real answer, not what you think we want to hear)



5. **Availability:**

Are you currently working for other clients? If yes:

   - How many hours per week are you working now?

   - How much notice do you need to give?

   - Can you commit to consistent hours if hired?



6. **Reading Comprehension Test:**

This job posting mentioned we're a "faith-based family business." In your own words, what does that tell you about our work culture? (This tests if you actually read the posting)



7. **Rate & Commitment:**

   - What is your expected hourly rate?

   - Are you looking for short-term project work or long-term employment?

   - Why?

Next Steps

We're looking to hire within 2 weeks.

If selected for interview, we'll schedule a brief Google Meet to discuss the role and answer your questions.

We value your time - we'll respond to all qualified applications within 3 business days.

title: Technical Writer
description:
A US-based consulting company is looking to hire a hard-working and self-motivated Filipino Technical Writer to create and document processes and procedures for our clients. Impeccable mastery of the English language (both written and verbal) is a must. 



This role is 100% work from home.



Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:



• Map process flows based on a recording of the consultant interviewing the client. This includes creating flow charts and diagrams. 

• Write high-quality, clear, easy-to-understand step-by-step procedures based on a recording of an interview of a client or videos submitted directly by clients on how they perform certain tasks.

• Organize the material in a cloud-based process documentation software or Learning Management System software. 

• Use videos, screenshots, links, etc to provide a balance between written material and demonstration of the material and to ensure full understanding. 

• Identify points of improvement and communicate it clearly to the consultant you are working with 

• Use our internal systems to communicate about their work and report daily on progress. 





About You:



• 3+ years of experience in technical writing, creating instructions, creating flow charts, process mapping, and process improvement background. 

• Ability to translate highly technical information into easily understandable information

• Very good understanding of the business world and high familiarity with common terms 

• Experience in process documentation and process improvement 

• Ability to duplicate what is said and translate it into writing

• Excellent mastery of the English language including grammar, punctuation and spelling. 

• Good mastery of MS Products (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) and Google suite 

• Detail-oriented, efficient and concise

• Ability to critical thinking and problem-solving





Compensation: 



• Competitive salary

• Training and mentorship

• Awesome culture and work-from-home set-up

• SSS, Philhealth, and Pag-ibig

• Healthcare (HMO)

• 13th Month Pay

• Paid incentive leave 

• Yearly performance review





How to apply:



Please fill out this application form: 
. We will only respond to candidates that meet the above qualifications.

title: Pre-Sales Proposal Specialist (Digital Marketing) — Google Docs
description:
About Warren Digital

Warren Digital is a performance-driven digital agency working with service businesses (including home builders) to generate quality leads and long-term growth through Google Ads, Meta Ads, SEO, and conversion-focused websites.



The Role

We’re looking for a Pre-Sales Proposal Specialist who can take a strategy brief from our director and turn it into a client-ready, beautifully formatted proposal in Google Docs — fast.



You won’t be on client calls. Your job is to convert a brief into a proposal that sells: clear, persuasive, well-structured, and on-brand.



What you’ll do



Turn a brief + notes into a complete proposal (Google Docs)



Write benefit-led strategy recommendations across:



Google Ads (search + lead gen)



Meta Ads (cold, lookalike, retargeting)



SEO (local authority + content strategy)



Website/CRO (landing pages, messaging, forms)



Present budgets, ranges, and phased rollouts cleanly



Keep proposals consistent with our tone, structure, and brand



Create and improve templates, blocks, and reusable sections over time



Turnaround expectations



Most proposals delivered within 24–48 hours (often faster)



You’re a great fit if you have



2+ years writing proposals for digital marketing services (agency or freelance)



Strong sales copywriting and positioning skills



Excellent Google Docs skills (styles, templates, formatting, tables)



Great eye for design, hierarchy, and readability



Comfortable working from a voice note / Loom / bullet brief



Bonus points



Experience with home builders, trades, or high-ticket local lead gen



Understanding of performance metrics (CPC, CPL, CVR, ROAS)



Ability to build proposal systems/templates that scale



How to apply

Please send:



1–3 examples of proposals you’ve written (redacted is fine)



Your availability and typical turnaround time



Your rate (per proposal or hourly)



A short note on your experience with Google Ads / Meta / SEO proposals

title: AI Marketing Assistant
description:

The core of this role is daily work with AI tools to create, edit and scale marketing content especially video and ad creatives. In addition to AI work, the role includes supporting marketing coordination and keeping workflows organized. title: ROCKSTAR ACCOUNTANT
description:
FULL-TIME NIGHT SHIFT | Remote | For High-Performance Professionals Only



Pivotl is seeking an exceptional Remote Accountant to join our specialized team providing advanced accounting services across the United States. This is a FULL-TIME, NIGHT SHIFT position designed for seasoned professionals who thrive under pressure and deliver excellence consistently.



IMPORTANT: This is NOT a side job or flexible arrangement. We need dedicated professionals accustomed to night shift operations who can commit to full-time hours. If you're seeking part-time work or are uncomfortable with night schedules, please do not apply.



What Sets This Role Apart

- 4-day work week, 3 days off - Maximize your work-life balance

- Premium compensation for proven high performers

- Comprehensive benefits: Paid vacation/sick leave, extensive paid training, generous Christmas bonus

- Complete autonomy in a remote environment - perfect for self-directed professionals

- Specialized focus on HOME SERVICE industries (HVAC, Solar, and related sectors)



The Challenge - Are You Ready?



We need a financial data cleanup specialist who can handle:

- Granular-level financial data reconciliation across complex business structures (Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet, AR, Vendor Recon)

- High-pressure deadline management while maintaining 100?curacy

- Independent problem-solving of complex accounting discrepancies

- Proactive identification and resolution of financial irregularities

- Core Responsibilities for Elite Performers

- Execute comprehensive book-cleanup projects with tight deadlines

- Perform detailed adjusting entries with a deep understanding of tax implications

- Master QuickBooks Online for complex multi-entity structures

- Conduct advanced data analysis using Excel and Google Sheets

- Manage full-cycle AR/AP, invoicing, payroll, and bank reconciliations

- Deliver precise categorization and accounting across diverse business models



Non-Negotiable Requirements

- Proven track record in US accounting with demonstrable results

- Expert-level proficiency in QuickBooks Online

- Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills for complex data manipulation

- Exceptional English communication - written and verbal

- Night shift availability - this is not flexible

- Autonomous work style - you must be self-directed and proactive

- Competitive Advantages (Preferred)

- Industry background in HVAC, solar, generators, roofing, foundations, or electrical

- Construction/contracting industry experience highly valued

- Experience using any of the following: Service Titan, Housecall Pro, Sera, Jobber, Service Trade, Acculynx, etc

- Experience using Keeper.app



Who Should Apply

- Rock stars only. We want professionals who:

- Thrive in high-pressure, deadline-driven environments

- Work autonomously without constant supervision

- Have extensive experience cleaning up complex historical financial data

- Take ownership of results and deliver consistent excellence

- Are committed to full-time night shift operations



Who Should NOT Apply

- Those seeking part-time or flexible arrangements

- Professionals are uncomfortable with night shift schedules

- Anyone looking for a "side job" or supplemental income

- Those requiring extensive hand-holding or micromanagement

- Ready to prove you're among the elite?



Apply Here: 
reers/bookkeeping-role

Pivotl - Where exceptional professionals build exceptional careers.

title: Finance Navigator – Patient Billing & Collections (Remote | Philippines)
description:
Finance Navigator – Patient Billing & Collections (Remote | Philippines)



Journey Psyche – U.S. Healthcare Practice

Pay: $6–$7 USD / hour

Type: Full-time

Remote (Philippines only)

Voice & Chat role – calling U.S. patients



ABOUT THE ROLE



Journey Psyche is a U.S.-based psychiatry and virtual care practice.

We are hiring a Finance Navigator who will be the primary communicator with patients regarding payments.



This role is NOT insurance claims and NOT backend billing.

Your job is clear, calm, professional communication with patients about balances and payments.



You are the voice of Journey Psyche.



WHAT YOU WILL DO

• Call U.S. patients regarding:

• Self-pay balances

• Payment follow-ups

• Alma and Headway coordination

• Explain billing clearly and professionally

• De-escalate confusion without pressure or threats

• Follow approved scripts and finance SOPs

• Document outcomes accurately

• Coordinate internally (claims handled by another team)



ENGLISH REQUIREMENT (VERY IMPORTANT)



We use the CEFR English standard.



C1 – ADVANCED (REQUIRED)

This role requires C1 Advanced English.



A C1 speaker:

• Speaks fluently and naturally

• Handles stress, emotion, and interruptions

• Sounds professional to U.S. patients

• Can explain billing clearly on live phone calls



 C2 – Near-Native (A plus, not required)



Below C1 (A1, A2, B1, B2) = NOT ACCEPTED



 Voice interview required. English will be tested live.



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

• C1 Advanced English (spoken & written)

• Clear, professional phone voice

• Comfortable discussing payments respectfully

• Strong listening and communication skills

• Reliable internet + quiet workspace

• Able to follow strict procedures



NICE TO HAVE (NOT REQUIRED)

• Healthcare, billing, or collections experience

• Customer support background

• Experience speaking with U.S. patients

• Familiarity with Alma or Headway





This role requires real conversation and judgment.



PAY & HOURS

• $6–$7 USD per hour

• Full-time

• Long-term role for the right candidate



?



HOW TO APPLY



Please include:

1. Your CEFR English level (C1 or C2 only)

2. A short note describing your voice/calling experience

3. Confirmation you are comfortable speaking with U.S. patients about payments



???? Applications below C1 English will not be considered.

title: Fast Wedding Photo Editor
description:
Experienced Wedding Photo Editor



A Note Before You Apply:



This is your first test. We do not consider generic, copy-and-pasted applications. If you don’t follow the instructions below precisely, your application will be archived. We’re looking for tea
mbers who are detail-oriented and committed, and that starts here.



You can find our founder on Instagram 
 to learn more about who you’d be working with.









TYPE OF WORK: Project-Based



WAGE / SALARY: Highly Competitive



HOURS PER WEEK: Varies by Project



JOB OVERVIEW



We are looking for a skilled and efficient Wedding Photo Editor to join our team. The ideal candidate has a strong portfolio in wedding photography and a proven ability to deliver high-quality edited photos with a fast turnaround. You will be responsible for culling, color correction, and final edits that match our brand's aesthetic.



We need a professional who can handle large volumes of photos, consistently meet deadlines, and produce stunning, emotionally resonant images. This is a role for a seasoned editor who understands the nuances of wedding photography and can work independently to deliver exceptional results.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



•

Cull large batches of raw photos to select the best images for the final gallery.



•

Perform high-quality color correction, exposure adjustments, and retouching on selected photos.

title: Video Editor & Marketing Content Specialist
description:
Location: Remote

Department: Marketing / Creative Services

Reports To: Marketing Manager or Creative Director



Job Overview

We are seeking a performance-driven and creative professional to join our team as a Video Editor & Marketing Content Specialist. This individual will bring a strong eye for composition, meticulous attention to detail, and a passion for visual storytelling. With a background in video production, graphic design, and marketing support, the ideal candidate will play a key role in developing content that enhances brand presence and engages our audience across digital channels.



Key Responsibilities

Video Production & Editing

Edit and produce high-quality short and long-form videos, including promotional content, product demos, and corporate communications.

Collaborate with the creative and marketing teams to storyboard, script, and finalize video content.

Ensure consistency in style, tone, and brand standards across all video materials.

Graphic Design

Design visual assets for marketing campaigns, social media, presentations, and product branding.

Support product and corporate branding initiatives through compelling design concepts.

Marketing & Content Support

Assist with social media strategy and content creation.

Write and edit blog posts, news stories, and marketing copy.

Conduct research and contribute to the development of marketing campaigns.

Administrative & Team Support

Provide general administrative and creative support to the marketing department.

Work cross-functionally with internal teams and clients to ensure timely and effective content delivery.



Qualifications

3–9 years of experience in video editing, marketing, and/or graphic design.

Proficiency in video editing software (Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut Pro, or equivalent).

Strong skills in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).

Experience with social media platforms and content creation tools.

Excellent communication, copywriting, and storytelling abilities.

Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time-management skills.

A collaborative mindset and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.



Preferred Qualifications

Background in corporate or product branding.

Experience working with cross-functional or development teams.

Familiarity with web content management systems and blog publishing tools.



Benefits

Competitive salary based on experience

Flexible work environment

Opportunities for professional growth and skill development

title: Social Media Manager - Long Term Employment US (Real Estate)
description:
We’re hiring a growth-minded Social Media Manager in the Philippines to support our top-producing luxury real estate team in San Francisco, CA, U.S. You must have a dedicated workspace free from distractions and be available from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. PST.



This is a long-term role for someone who wants to do high-quality work in a fast-moving, high-performing team. We operate with clear standards, strong communication, and a lot of trust. We move quickly, support each other, and focus on results — not just staying busy.



If you’re someone who takes ownership of your work, isn’t afraid to share your experience, give your opinion, or ask questions when you need clarity, and enjoys being part of a fast-paced team of A-players, you’ll fit in well here.



ABOUT US 



We are the Krishnan Team, one of the Top 3 real estate teams in San Francisco, with over $1 billion in closed sales since 2009. We believe strong results come from smart systems and people who care about doing things well. Our culture is built around:



-Fairness

-Accountability

-Continuous learning

-Collaboration



We also give back by donating 5% of our revenue to community organizations.



WHAT YOU'LL DO 



You’ll work closely with our Marketing Manager and leadership team to turn raw video, ideas, and strategy into high-impact Instagram content that strengthens our brand, attracts high-quality leads, and positions us as market leaders.



We’re looking for someone who thinks clearly, executes consistently, communicates openly, and isn’t afraid to speak up or share their ideas. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys contributing in a fast-moving, high-standard environment and wants their work to make a real impact.



You’ll have clear direction and expectations, and you’ll be trusted to manage your responsibilities and improve how things are done.



DAY TO DAY 



-Content Creation & Video Editing

-Edit short-form videos for Instagram Reels using CapCut

-Add hooks, captions, subtitles, and on-screen text

-Write SEO-optimized captions, alt text, and CTAs using Gemini, ChatGPT, or similar tools

-Create branded graphics and carousels using Canva

-Social Media Management

-Schedule and publish content on Instagram

-Monitor comments and messages

-Apply social SEO (keywords, geo-tags, alt text) so content is discoverable on Google

-Stay up to date on trends and algorithm changes



ANALYTICS & SYSTEMS



-Track engagement, reach, and performance

-Share insights on what’s working and what’s not

-Build and maintain workflows in Asana so content flows smoothly from filming to posting



SKILL AND EXPEREINCE 



-3+ years of experience in social media management, content creation, including video editing

-Strong short-form video editing skills (Reels)

-Ability to write engaging, professional captions

-Understanding of social media SEO and keyword usage

-Comfortable using Instagram, Canva, CapCut, Google Workspace, Asana, ManyChat, and Later

-Experience with U.S. clients is a plus

-Experience with real estate or luxury brands is a bonus



Ideally, you are familiar with or can quickly learn…



-Google Suite of Services

-Instagram,

-Canva

-LLMs

-Scheduling tools like Later

-Editing software like Capcut, Adobe Premiere Pro, or Final Cut Pro

-Project management tool like Asana



THE DETAILS 



HOW TO APPLY: Please include a link to your PDF resume and portfolio when applying. Candidates who do not follow these instructions will be considered.



-Salary: $1000-$1800 USD a month (including bonuses), commensurate with qualifications and experience.

NOTE: Exceptional candidates with extensive expertise and a proven track record may be considered for a higher compensation package.

-Benefits: Paid Time Off

-Hours: Full-time 40+ hours

-Location: Remote. This position is open to candidates residing in the Philippines only.

-(Office is based in San Francisco, CA) You must have a dedicated workspace free from distractions and be available from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. PST.



TOOLS 



-Computer Minimum System Requirements:

-CPU: Intel or AMD processor with 64-bit support, 2 GHz or faster processor

-RAM: 8 GB and above

-GPU: 2GB and above

-Headset

-Connectivity: Minimum of 10 Mbps and up wired DSL

--(USB sticks, pocket wifi, signal-based & wireless connections are not recommended)



We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Chief Operations Officer / Operations Manager
description:
Operations & Compliance Coordinator (US Pest Control Company) – Full-Time, Long-Term



We are a fast?growing US pest control company looking for a full?time Operations & Compliance Coordinator to join our remote team. As we continue to expand into new states and open more branches, this role is critical to keeping our operations organized, compliant, and scalable. There are real growth opportunities for the right person as we scale.



Salary: 1,300–1,600 USD/month (depending on experience)

Schedule: Full-time, 40 hours/week, 9:00 AM–5:00 PM Mountain Time (PH night shift, must be able to work these exact hours)

Role Type: Remote, long?term



How to Apply (Required)

If you are interested and can start soon, please complete our online interview here:



???? 



We will only review candidates who complete this online interview.



What You Will Do

1. Employee Onboarding



Prepare and process onboarding paperwork for new hires.



Ensure all onboarding documents and requirements are complete and compliant.



Coordinate introductory training sessions and help new hires get set up for success.



Set up
 accounts and access to key software and internal systems.



2. Licensing Management



Track all required state licenses (company and technicians) and ensure renewals are submitted on time.



Maintain up?to?date local and state business licenses across multiple states.



Monitor technician licenses, schedule trainings or renewals, and notify supervisors and techs of upcoming expirations.



3. Fleet Management



Track vehicle maintenance schedules weekly using Fleet Pro or similar tools.



Update driver assignments and vehicle records as needed.



Enter weekly fuel and mileage logs.



Generate monthly fleet performance and cost reports.



4. Housing & Lease Coordination



Source and secure short?term housing (around 4 months) for sales teams in multiple summer markets (searching typically starts March–April; move?ins April–May).



Manage housing leases, deposits, utilities, and billing, including move?in and move?out coordination.



Help identify and negotiate leases for 3–4 new branch locations per year.



Help track and manage rep locations to monitor spending and reduce risk/liability.



5. Marketing Deal & Expense Management



Track all sales team expenses that are part of each sales leader’s marketing deal (housing, incentives, marketing, etc.).



Keep expenses organized by team and market for clear post?season reporting.



Provide accurate expense summaries to support commission and override calculations after the summer season.



6. Legal & Entity Compliance



Track and file annual/biennial reports for multiple LLCs and entities across several states.



Coordinate with accountants to support month?end and year?end bookkeeping for each entity and branch.



Assist with new entity setup (LLC formation, DBAs, EINs, foreign registrations, and related business license filings/renewals).



What We’re Looking For

3+ years experience in operations, admin, compliance, property management, or similar.



Strong English communication skills (written and spoken).



Highly organized, detail?oriented, and comfortable managing many moving parts at once.



Confident using spreadsheets and online tools (Google Sheets/Excel, project management tools, CRMs, etc.).



Experience with US?based businesses, real estate/leasing, fleet, or multi?state compliance is a big plus but not required.



Reliable internet, backup power preferred, and a quiet home office setup.



Able and willing to work 9:00 AM–5:00 PM Mountain Time (PH night shift) Monday to Friday.



What We Offer

Competitive salary: 1,300–1,600 USD/month based on experience.



Long?term, stable role with a fast?growing company.



13th?month pay and paid PH holidays (if you offer these, keep this line; if not, remove it).



Clear growth opportunities as we expand into new states, add more branches, and grow our remote operations team (potential to move into senior operations, compliance, or leadership roles over time).



Supportive leadership that values input, systems, and process improvements.



To be considered, please complete the online interview here (required):

???? 



Once you have completed the online interview we will set up a zoom interview with the founders of the company.

title: Skype Gigs, Use Multiple Skills, Paid Training
description:
GIG job, sharing your screen on TEAMS. Here is your job readiness test: Read the whole job post carefully, save it, and follow all instructions. 

Reply directly to 
 using the format described below. Subject line format is specified below and must include GIG. Apply any time in 2026. 



Hello! My name is EVE SUTTON (she/her). I am a teacher who works on curriculum design online for levels K-12 and Adult, and other projects for consumer education.  I write LOOONG instructions, so you must have excellent English skills for reading comprehension!  Projects include affiliate marketing, a WordPress website, and YouTube channels.  Everything is customized as we work together -- NO Woo Commerce, NO ready-made WordPress templates.   I specify the color pallet as web-safe HEX codes. I specify the font style and sizes.  I have rules for how we name each file and what formats we use for each project.  If you like rules, we will work well together!



Most work is done in real time while we share a screen on TEAMS: You do not need to show your face but you will follow my instructions while I watch for ways to improve the process. Highest need Feb 2026 is developing a WordPress site for affiliate marketing of consumer protection (bike locks, home security, anti-theft products) using Lasso to enhance the affiliate links  (GetLasso.co) . Typical process: I get an idea, I research the details, then you do some research that I describe,  we develop the work flow, find why it will not work, try again, etc. I do not mind if we take forever to create the first version and keep modifying -- as long as the end result is top quality: Easy to use, self-sustaining, high SEO, high conversion to sales and profits, etc.  Be patient as I change my instructions with new ideas during the meetings.  



Hours: 5-10 hours per week until we are really moving quickly to finish a project, then up to 30 hours/week.  We arrange each meeting time a day or two in advance, and you will call me at the exact start time we arrange. I have worked with Philippine VAs for 2 years so I understand if typhoons or other events interrupt our plans, but you should be reliable generally. I pay by the hour because I change my mind often as we design new projects and I learn what will or will not work. I usually pay after each session through PayPal, unless we agree to have you send an invoice a day or two later. Later you might do small amounts of work on your own, after we have a very clear plan.  Yes, I micro-manage!  This job post is a good test of your ability to follow exact instructions.



When you are ready to work, please  Reply to 
  with this exact format  (example below)  for SUBJECT: 

Phil VA Teams GIG _____: ________, ____ PhP/hour [or $___/hour]

[write your Online VA name after Gig: ] : [write your main skills], [Write your hourly rate in PhP  or US Dollars; I can pay either way through PayPal]  



Example SUBJECT:  Phil VA Teams GIG Lupe A. Garcia: WordPress & SEO, 300PhP/hr



Body of
:

Intro to your full name, availability, and URL to your OnlineJobs.ph  portfolio page

Schedule of your usual available days/hours for TEAMS meetings working on shared screen 



List your available times for TEAMS meetings, showing California hours = Philippine hours (16 hrs ahead). Use 12:15 instead of noon or midnight to avoid confusion. Always list CA first , mentally add 16 hours, then list Philippine time.

 EXAMPLE:

I am available CA Mon-Thurs CA 12:15pm to 4:30pm  = PH Tues-Fri  4:15am to 8:15am

 

THEN add your PORTFOLIO LINKS, work samples, etc. Best links are regular URLs -- not Google Docs, not filed behind a pay wall or special account.



You may forward this job description to others who are good for these gig jobs. 

Allow 2 days for reply, then send me a reminder
 if needed.

 As a VA on my team, you earn by the hour while you learn new skills; I pay for training time. Your English must be fluent or almost fluent. Most important,  you must be RELIABLE and good at FOLLOWING DIRECTIONS.  Every VA's work must follow the same specifications so the pieces will fit together. Your reply to this job posting  is your first test: 



1. Reply to 
 using the exact format above in your
 SUBJECT line.  

2. Inside your
, please introduce yourself, explain why your skills apply to these projects, and list what days and hours you are available to meet by
. (You can hide your face but you must share your screen as we work together.)  Show your schedule in CA and PH time zones, with CA first, in a format like this:

 

CA Mon-Thurs 8:15am-2:30pm = PH Tues-Fri 12:15am*-5:30am 

CA Fri 4:15pm-7pm = PH Sat 7:15am-10am   

* Never list 12:00 -- too confusing. Always change to 12:15 so am and pm are understood.

__content targeting to match search trends  _
 marketing  __advertising on social media   



Faceless YouTube channel and Video Creation:   __ SEO tools ___YouTube  thumbnails   __Description with disclosures for affiliate links, high SEO ,  great backlink development  __generating prompts or  scripts for shorts and longer videos  ___Adobe AfterEffects or CapCut for  video creation using 2D motion graphics   __teaching or helping viewers use the curriculum in YouTube channels



Bonus Other SKILLS LIST  for my side project, a Stageplay or Screenplay:  __taking dictation (listen and write accurately)  __formatting a script (MS Word or Final Draft)   __Sibelius for taking music dictation and editing music scores  __singing   __voice acting  __mixing and mastering audio files

title: Community Manager
description:
About Us

We run an e-commerce business in the herbal healing space, rooted in Traditional Chinese Medicine (a bonus if you're familiar). We are 100% Direct to Consumer (DTC) and largely a subscription-based business. Our Ambassador Program is a key growth channel, and we're looking for someone to lead outreach, management, and social engagement while providing community care through customer support.

Role Overview

This is a hybrid role focused primarily on ambassador management and social media engagement (70%) with customer experience support (30%). You'll report to the Head of Community Care and work closely with our CX Lead Agent and the broader CX team. You'll own the day-to-day ambassador relationships, social listening, content curation, and community engagement across Instagram and TikTok.

Primary Responsibilities: Ambassador Management & Social Media (70%)

Ambassador Outreach & Relationship Management

Source and recruit new ambassadors through proactive outreach on Instagram, TikTok, and other social platforms

Manage ambassador onboarding process and ongoing relationship nurturing

Process ambassador applications. 

Track ambassador performance, content creation, and program engagement

Coordinate ambassador campaigns to drive additional conversions 

Coordinate ambassador communications, including newsletter updates and program announcements

Request and organize raw b-roll content from ambassadors for internal content library

Monitor and report on ambassador-driven metrics and conversion performance

Social Media Engagement & Community Building

Reply to comments on our brand’s Instagram and TikTok accounts 

Complete social engagement with ambassadors and niche creators in hormone health, TCM, period education, nervous system regulation, and holistic wellness across Instagram,
 groups, TikTok, Reddit

Leave thoughtful, specific comments on ambassador and relevant creator content (not generic engagement)

Build authentic relationships with emerging creators in our niche

Stay culturally relevant within the hormone health and TCM communities

Content Curation & Trend Research

Conduct weekly trending content research across TikTok and Instagram and identify trending videos/Reels weekly related to period symptoms, TCM, hormone healing, herbs, stress regulation, and related topics

Save content to organized collections and log links in tracking spreadsheet with analysis (hook, format, why it's trending)

Monitor daily social media tags, repost ambassador content to brand stories with branded backgrounds, and send personalized thank-you messages via DM

Download, organize, and archive all ambassador mentions, story tags, and weekly organic posts following established naming conventions and Drive folder structure

Secondary Responsibilities: Customer Experience (30%)

Respond to
, chat, or social media tickets from current and prospective customers, including:

Cancellation requests, website issues, shipping issues, order questions, product education

Follow Standard Operating Procedures when handling tickets

Escalate complex tickets to Lead Agent according to protocol

Process refunds, re-shipments, and other customer requests

Log product, fulfillment, and technology defects

Contribute customer insights during tea
etings

Additional Responsibilities

Work 40 hours per week over 5 days

Support ad-hoc projects across Ops, Marketing, and Community Care teams

Maintain organized tracking systems for ambassador activities, social engagement, and customer interactions

The Ideal Candidate Will Have:

Required:

Exceptional English writing capabilities (understanding American terminology and expressions)

2+ years experience in influencer outreach, social media community management, or ambassador program coordination

Strong Instagram and TikTok native skills with ability to identify trends, spot emerging creators, and engage authentically

Highly organized with meticulous attention to detail 

Experience with customer service handling
, chat, and SMS inbound tickets

Experience with Aspire, Shopify, Recharge, Gorgias, and Google Suite (especially Drive organization)

Comfort using AI tools (ChatGPT or other LLMs) to improve messaging and efficiency

Ability to work weekends (consistent schedule with start time between 8am-12pm EST, end time 5pm-9pm EST)

Self-starter mentality with ability to manage independent weekly tasks and proactively communicate status

Empathetic, warm communication style focused on building genuine relationships (not transactional engagement)

Eye for quality content and understanding of what makes posts replicable or scroll-stopping

Preferred:

Experience at an American DTC e-commerce startup in women's CPG, wellness, or healthcare

Prior experience managing or working with influencer/ambassador programs

Familiarity with Traditional Chinese Medicine, hormone health, or holistic wellness topics

Experience using content download tools and building organized content libraries

Experience with quiz platforms (Digioh, Pickzen, etc.)

Prior experience working with AI agents, escalating issues, and troubleshooting rules and knowledge bases

Personal interest in wellness, cycle health, or TCM

Next Steps

Please upload your resume and fill out this screening assessment: 
 to help us assess your interest in this role and how you handle various customer and ambassador scenarios. If it seems like a good fit, we'll reach out to schedule an interview. We'd love for someone to start by early March.

-time

title: B2B Sales Manager
description:
We’re hiring a commercial leader to own revenue across a portfolio of real estate services, SaaS products, and outsourcing solutions. 



This role is designed for someone who enjoys closing complex B2B deals, is comfortable speaking directly about money and outcomes, and wants meaningful ownership—not just a quota. 



You’ll work closely with the CEO, operate with real autonomy, and play a key role in shaping how we go to market as we scale. 



THE OPPORTUNITY 



This is not a narrow, single-product sales role. 



You will: 



Own the full sales cycle end-to-end 



Represent multiple high-value offerings 



Influence pricing, positioning, and deal structure 



Build long-term commercial relationships, not transactional wins 



If you’re at a point in your career where you want more responsibility, more trust, and more upside, this role is built for that. 



WHAT YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR 



Revenue & Pipeline Ownership 



Build and manage your own B2B pipeline through outbound outreach, referrals, and strategic follow-ups 



Engage directly with decision-makers across real estate, SaaS, and professional services Advance opportunities with confidence and commercial judgment 



Sales Execution 



Run effective discovery calls and demos focused on business outcomes 



Lead pricing, negotiation, and close conversations 



Identify and execute upsell, renewal, and cross-sell opportunities across brands 



Commercial Leadership 



Represent the CEO in sales conversations and negotiations 



Own key accounts through close and early lifecycle stability 



Surface new revenue opportunities and market insights proactively 



Accountability & Visibility 



Maintain a clean, accurate CRM (GoHighLevel preferred) 



Report weekly on pipeline value, close rate, deal velocity, and revenue performance Be measured on outcomes, not busywork







Requirements

WHO THRIVES IN THIS ROLE 



This role is a strong fit if you: 



Have 3 or more years closing B2B deals in SaaS, agencies, outsourcing, or real estate services Are comfortable generating opportunities, not just handling inbound leads 



Enjoy consultative selling, negotiation, and problem-solving 



Can operate independently while collaborating with leadership 



Take pride in owning a number and improving it



Experience with GoHighLevel, real estate brokerages, or agency services is a strong advantage. 







Benefits

GROWTH, COMPENSATION & ACCESS 



Base Salary: Competitive and aligned with experience 



Commission: Uncapped, performance-driven, and meaningful 



Growth Path: Clear runway to Director of Sales for the right performer 



Access: Direct line to the CEO and influence over sales strategy 



This is a role where strong performance is visible, rewarded, and expanded. 





OUR HIRING APPROACH 

?

We value real experience over polished resumes. 



Candidates will be asked to: 



Walk through deals they personally closed 



Explain how they handled hesitation or resistance 



Share real metrics including deal size, close rates, and pipeline ownership 



If you’ve carried revenue responsibility before, this process will feel natural.

title: US Based Company - Remote Records Specialist
description:
We are a leading US-based digital media company operating in the crime and justice journalism space. Our mission is to provide transparency and education to the general public in the United States of America.



This is not a standard virtual assistant role. This is a specialized, outcome-focused position requiring precision, persistence, and world-class communication.





Your Core Outcome



Acquire the public records (i
 reports, video footage, audio, documents) that power our journalism. You will fully own the lifecycle of public records requests, from drafting to acquisition.





Responsibilities



- Draft, file, and track high-volume public records (FOIA/PRA) requests with US-based agencies.

- Professionally manage a high-volume
 inbox, following up persistently and politely.

- Maintain a detailed tracking database for deadlines, statuses, payments, and follow-ups.

- Securely download, organize, and manage large digital files.

- Conduct daily research of US local news outlets to identify i
 worth requesting.

- Attend regular Zoo
etings to report pipeline progress.





Qualifications



- Extremely detail-oriented; you double-check everything.

- Flawless written English; professional, clear, concise.

- Persistent and proactive, you do not wait for instructions.

- Strong ethics and confidentiality standards.

- Reliable high-speed internet (non-negotiable).

- Experience with digital tools (Google Workspace, spreadsheets, Asana/Trello/ClickUp).





Schedule: Full-time, with some overlap required with US morning hours.





Compensation: Competitive full-time salary based on experience.





Culture: We operate with professionalism, transparency, and respect. We maintain high standards and support you with comprehensive training and transparent processes.

title: Self Storage Customer Service Representative
description:
LocalStorage Group is dedicated to delivering outstanding customer service at competitive prices, ensuring every customer’s storage needs are met with care, professionalism, and attention to detail. With conveniently located facilities in prime, easily accessible areas, we make storage simple and stress-free no matter where our customers are coming from.



We take pride in maintaining clean, secure, and well-managed environments that provide peace of mind and reliability. Whether customers require short-term or long-term storage solutions, LocalStorage Group is committed to offering high-quality, tailored options that create a seamless and trustworthy storage experience from start to finish.



JOB DESCRIPTION 



The Customer Service Representative at LocalStorage Group plays a key role in delivering exceptional customer experiences by building strong relationships and providing tailored storage solutions. This position is responsible for engaging with customers across multiple communication channels, including inbound and outbound phone calls,
, text messaging, and chat support, to effectively address inquiries, resolve issues, and identify sales opportunities.



The representative supports both new and existing customers by assisting with storage unit rentals, protection plans, and related services, while also managing customer accounts, processing payments, and conducting follow-ups on outstanding balances. This role requires a consultative, service-driven approach that balances sales performance with high-quality customer care.



Operating in a remote, fast-paced environment, the Customer Service Representative works independently while collaborating with tea
mbers across locations. Success in this role requires strong communication skills, adaptability, and comfort using technology to efficiently manage customer interactions and deliver consistent, professional service.



SKILLS



· Minimum of 3 years of customer service experience, including both inbound and outbound interactions in a call center or customer support environment.



· Proven sales experience, with the ability to confidently promote and sell storage units, protection plans, and related services.



· Strong communication skills across phone,
, text, and chat, with a professional, friendly, and solution-oriented approach.



· Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment while maintaining accountability and performance in a remote setting.



· Positive attitude with a strong work ethic, adaptability, and a customer-first mindset.



· Self-motivated and dependable, able to manage time effectively, take initiative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS 



Individuals must be able to perform the essential functions of this position with or without reasonable accommodation. LocalStorage Group is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, provided such accommodations do not create an undue hardship.



This role requires the ability to work for extended periods in a home or remote office environment, including sitting at a desk, using a computer, and handling phone-based communications. The employee must be able to view computer screens, read digital and written materials, and effectively operate standard office equipment, with or without corrective devices.



The position also requires the flexibility to shift between tasks throughout the workday while maintaining focus, productivity, and accuracy. Employees must be able to organize and maintain an efficient workspace that supports performance, comfort, and ergonomic needs.

 Strong problem-solving and process improvement mindset



Experience

Communication

What Success Looks Like in This Role

 Manual work is reduced through smart automation

title: Process & Training Coordinator
description:
Position: Process & Training Coordinator

Location: Philippines (Remote)

Reports to: Head of Operations

Type: Full-Time



About Maid My Day

Maid My Day is a leading provider of Domestic Assistance services within the Australian Aged Care sector. We support elderly Australians to live safely and independently in their own homes, while also creating meaningful employment for our field workforce.



Everything we do is grounded in care, reliability and consistency.

For our elderly clients, that means trust and dignity.

For our field staff, that means feeling supported, confident and set up to succeed.



As we grow, the experience our office team creates for our field team directly impacts the experience our elderly clients receive. This role exists to protect and strengthen that connection.





 - Why This Role Exists - 

We are undergoing a business-wide transformation focused on building a world-class employee experience.



Our office teams play a critical role in this. When they are trained, aligned and confident in our processes, they can support our field staff properly  -- which allows our Home Support Workers to focus on what matters most: caring for our elderly clients.



This role exists to ensure every office tea
mber knows exactly how to do their job, why it matters, and how it supports both our field staff and the people we serve.





 - The Role in a Nutshell -

You are the owner of process clarity and internal training.



Your role is to take the knowledge, expectations and ways of working held by leadership and turn them into clear processes and training materials for our office teams.



You don’t just document processes — you train our office staff to follow them consistently, understand the “why”, and apply them in a way that supports our field staff and protects the client experience.





 - What You’ll Do - 

1. Process Discovery

You uncover how work should be done — and how it’s actually being done.

Meet with Team Leads across Operations, Scheduling, Cleaner Management, Finance and Sales

Ask detailed questions to fully understand office workflows

Break complex explanations into clear, step-by-step processes

Identify gaps, inconsistencies or points of confusion

Recommend improvements to strengthen consistency and support



2. Documentation & Playbooks

You create clarity people can rely on.

Write simple, practical process documents, checklists and flowcharts

Ensure instructions are easy to follow and suitable for day-to-day office use

Maintain version control so teams always use the correct process

Keep our internal process library clean, current and trusted



3. Office Team Training & Enablement

You ensure our people understand the process, not just read it.

Create training materials for office teams (guides, slides, scripts or short videos)

Deliver or support training sessions when processes change

Equip Team Leads to reinforce processes within their teams

Ensure office staff understand how their role impacts field staff and client experience



4. Quality & Consistency Guardian

You help protect the experience we deliver.

Ensure processes are applied consistently across office teams

Help reduce errors, rework and confusion

Support audit readiness and documentation requirements

Continuously improve clarity as the business evolves





 - Who You Are -

You are someone who:

Loves structure, clarity and logical thinking

Communicates simply and clearly

Is confident asking questions until you fully understand

Enjoys training and helping others feel confident

Is calm, methodical and detail-oriented

Is comfortable using tools to document, organise and train





 - How We Measure Success - 

You’re succeeding when:

Office staff confidently follow processes without guesswork

Team Leads spend less time answering “how do I do this?” questions

Errors, rework and confusion reduce across teams

Process changes are adopted smoothly

Office teams are better equipped to support field staff

Field staff experience more consistency and support





 - This Role Is NOT a Fit If - 

You expect others to document processes for you

You prefer managing people rather than building systems

You struggle to simplify complex or incomplete information

You are uncomfortable training or enabling others

You get frustrated by fast-moving, evolving environments





- HOW TO APPLY - 

Please
 Chelle at 
 with:

Subject line: Application for HSW Manager

Your resume

A short note on why this role resonates with you

• Identify and escalate issues related to promos, tracking, or data integrity

Requirements



• 3–5+ years of hands-on paid media experience

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

• High attention to detail and operational discipline

• Experience managing multiple campaigns or brands simultaneously

• Comfortable working independently in a fast-paced environment



What This Role Is NOT



• Not a strategy-only or reporting-only role

• Not a junior media buyer position

• Not a “set it and forget it” account management role

Sales Development Representative (SDR)

: Compensation: Hourly base + commission on closed demos

: Opportunity to learn, grow

: The candidate, if hired with MC, is only for ManageCasa. If you're planning to work for two companies, we don't want to waste your time. 

: looking for Honest and reliable SDR

What You’ll Do

s using HubSpot to spark conversations.

Hit monthly quota goals.

Strong written communication skills, able to craft creative, engaging
s.

Confidence and persistence are required to make a high volume of calls daily.

Team player works closely with Sales to maximize results.

Goal-driven and results-focused.

title: Email Marketing Manager (ECommerce) - Full Time, Remote
description:
We are looking for a strategic and performance-driven
 & SMS Marketing Manager to lead the charge in growing and optimizing our owned marketing channels. This role is key to delivering high-converting campaigns that drive customer engagement, retention, and revenue across our skincare and hair care product lines. You’ll turn customer insights into action, bringing value at every touchpoint while aligning messaging with product and brand goals.





Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

Own the strategy, execution, and optimization of all
 and SMS campaigns for multiple product lines (e.g., hair thinning shampoo, supplements, anti-aging SPF, and skin supplements).

Segment audiences and personalize messaging to maximize relevance, engagement, and conversion.

Develop and manage high-performing lifecycle flows including welcome, cart abandonment, post-purchase, and win-back sequences.

A/B test subject lines, content, offers, and creative assets to continuously improve key performance metrics (CTR, open rate, CVR, revenue per send).

Monitor and report on campaign performance; adjust strategy based on insights and trends.

Build surveys and gather customer feedback to inform future content and product ideas.

Collaborate with creative, product, and customer experience teams to ensure consistent and on-brand messaging.

Maintain a strong understanding of compliance and best practices in
/SMS marketing (e.g., CAN-SPAM, TCPA).

Suggest and implement new technologies, tools, and tactics to stay ahead of the curve.





Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in
 and SMS marketing, ideally in eCommerce or beauty/wellness.

Expert in Klaviyo or similar marketing automation platforms.

Strong writing skills and a keen eye for visual branding and user experience.

Solid understanding of customer behavior, segmentation, and marketing psychology.

Results-oriented with a deep passion for data, testing, and optimization.

Familiarity with tools like Rebuy or product recommendation engines is a plus.

Proactive, curious, and comfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

Passion for skincare, wellness, and helping people feel their best.





What You’ll Help Shape:



Your role goes beyond sending campaigns—you’ll help us build smarter customer journeys by listening to our audience. You'll turn feedback into better product launches, sharper messaging, and a stronger brand voice. You’re part marketer, part strategist, part customer advocate.





Ready to Apply? Please answer the following questions:



*Job Preferences:

Are you comfortable working on graveyard shift, 40hrs/wk?

What is your current salary?

What is your expected salary (in USD, per hour)?

Are you open to working with a time tracker?

Are you able to provide a contact from your previous employer for character reference?

Are you available to start immediately?



*Marketing Experience

Years of experience do you have in end-to-end
 marketing (including writing the
)?:

Years of experience in SMS Marketing:

Years of experience in Klaviyo:

Years of experience in
 Marketing for e-commerce:

Largest annual revenue brand you’ve managed (in USD):

Biggest
 listing size:

Have you worked before with US clients?:



Additionally, please share a link to your CV and portfolio ensure it is accessible.



Due to the high volume of applications, only qualified candidates will be contacted. We appreciate your time and interest!



About Us



Ennovation Brands, the parent company of Skin Research Institute (SRI), is dedicated to creating innovative, science-backed beauty and wellness products that deliver real results. With a strong and growing customer base, our mission is to provide high-quality solutions that enhance everyday lives. At SRI, we focus on premium skincare and beauty tools, blending creativity, research, and customer insight to drive meaningful impact. We’re passionate about delivering exceptional value and building genuine connections with our audience.





Learn more:

title: Cabinet Engineer (Mozaik)
description:
At Axon Cabinets, we specialize in manufacturing and selling quality kitchen cabinets. We focus on innovative approaches, quality materials, unique designs and affordable rates. Our aim is to make our client's lives easier by making their kitchens more functional.



Job description



We are searching for an attentive and capable Cabinet Engineer to join our team, and some of the responsibilities and tasks of the position include:



Able to identify possible problems with designs and construction methods and work with designers to resolve

Interpret drawings, specs, and any additional information from designers in order to properly communicate customer expectations to production team and installers

Effective and efficient use of time through a strong understanding and ability utilizing AutoCAD, Sketchup & Mozaik.

Able to interpret key appliances openings & accessory information to produce accurate cabinetry.

Apply understanding of cabinetry production as it relates to shop drawings, material yield, and labor

Ensure that engineered jobs are accurate and complete to enable execution of the designer’s intent at installation of the project.

Be the liason between the designers and our product engineers in the shop.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:



Excellent verbal and written communication skills

High level of proficiency and aptitude with the latest computer technology

Professionalism in dealing with customer issues.

Demonstrable understanding of kitchen design, engineering, and production

Detailed knowledge in the use of Mozaik, Blue Beam, Adobe Acrobat and Microsoft applications

Knowledge of custom cabinetry manufacturing, shop machinery and more.

Education and Experience



High School Degree or GED Required

Minimum 5 years of experience within cabinetry/manufacturing industry

Experience with Mozaik would be beneficial

Job Type: Full-time

title: Customer Service - Dropshipping (WEEKLY PAY)
description:
Dear,



We run an eCommerce dropshipping business with multiple stores in different countries.



We are looking for long-term employees to join our team. There is a great deal of growth opportunity for those that consistently make a positive contribution to our company. We are seeking great candidates that will represent the company with great customer service and dedication.



So essentially this is a Customer Support job where you would have to follow a very clear process to keep our customers happy, but which will become very simple when you understand every step.



MUST HAVE KNOWLEDGE OF THESE PLATFORMS:



Zoho Mail (support help desk)

Shopify (eCommerce platform)

Whatsapp / 
 (communication channel)

DeepL (for translation)



Responsibilities:



Handling customer complaints.

Reporting on refunds/complaints.

Responding to customer
s regarding refunds, tracking numbers, FAQs.

Contributing to our documentation and improving our support processes.

Respond to all customer inquiries in a timely and accurate manner.

We maintain an ETA of 24 hours so you must reply to the
s within this timeframe.

Demonstrate a high level of professionalism at all times.



We will provide you with:



Video training

SOP to follow

Access to the Lead customer support to answer all your questions.



Applicant needs to:



Speak fluent English both written and verbally

Minimum 2 years of experience in Customer Support

Be available for weekly team calls 

Must be organized, motivated, and willing to learn and grow.

Available to join immediately



Be available for a minimum of 20 hours per week once you are asked to start working full-time, we will start with two weeks trial and then turn from part-time to full-time.

Not currently working for other full-time jobs



Ideally, you'll have some experience with customer support, but ultimately we want to work with someone who loves helping people and is interested in handling customer support issues. I don't want any inconsistency in the
s exchanged with the customer. Example: twice the same
, imprecise answer, off-topic answer, etc.



Please respond by telling me what similar experience you have had before and tell me why you think you are a good fit for this job!



Requirements for application validation:

- Include the word “Mushroom” in the application.



I look forward to your proposal.



Thank you.
