title: Underwriter (Real Estate)
description:
Join Easydwell and Help Shape Smarter Homeownership



Easydwell is a fast-growing real estate fund focused on rethinking how homeownership is accessed and managed. We’re looking for a sharp, detail-driven Underwriter who thrives on analysis, precision, and sound judgment.



This role is for professionals who naturally think in numbers, question assumptions, and enjoy digging into data until the full story emerges. If you bring a disciplined underwriting mindset and want to operate as a true owner within a high-growth environment, this could be a strong fit.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

You will play a critical role in protecting portfolio integrity by evaluating risk with accuracy, consistency, and sound reasoning.

- Property Valuation & Market Analysis

Perform and interpret comparative market analyses (comps) to determine realistic property values and identify market trends.

- Risk Assessment

Review applicant financials, credit reports, and property-level data to evaluate overall risk exposure.

- Underwriting Decisions

Provide well-reasoned recommendations to approve, decline, or counter applications in alignment with Easydwell’s underwriting standards.

- Documentation Review & Verification

Cross-check all submitted documents to ensure accuracy, consistency, and compliance, identifying red flags or discrepancies when present.

- Clear Internal Communication

Document underwriting decisions and rationale in concise, professional written reports for internal stakeholders.



What We’re Looking For

This role is best suited for analytical professionals who value precision, accountability, and high standards.

- Strong Numerical & Analytical Skills

Exceptional comfort working with financial data, identifying patterns, and drawing defensible conclusions.

- Advanced Excel Proficiency

Confident using formulas, structured models, and data organization to support underwriting decisions.

- Real Estate Valuation Experience (Preferred)

Prior experience running comps and evaluating property values in real estate or related markets is strongly preferred.

- Relevant Background

Experience in underwriting (real estate, mortgage, or financial services) is ideal. Candidates with strong finance or analytical backgrounds and proven learning agility will also be considered.

- Excellent English Communication

Clear, professional written and verbal communication is essential, including strong pronunciation for effective collaboration with global teams.

title: AGILE / SCRUM MASTER - PROJECT COORDINATOR
description:
Role overview: Agile/Scrum Master Certified



We are seeking a Project Coordinator (Scrum Master/Agile) to lead the execution, coordination, and delivery of client and internal development initiatives.



Full-time | Work-From-Home | Graveyard Shift | $8-12/hr



Qualifications:



- Recognized Scrum Master certification is highly preferred

- 3–6 years of professional experience in Delivery Management, Project Management, Scrum Mastery, or comparable roles within Agile frameworks.

- Experience supporting software development teams in Agile or hybrid environments

- Strong facilitation, communication, and organizational skills

- Proven ability to manage multiple workstreams and resolve issues proactively

- Comfortable communicating directly with clients and senior stakeholders

- Proficiency with tools such as Jira, Linear, ClickUp, Asana, or similar systems



Key Responsibilities:



*Delivery & Project Management

- Oversee day-to-day delivery of client and internal engineering projects

- Track progress against timelines, milestones, and commitments

- Maintain project plans, schedules, and regular status updates

- Anticipate risks, dependencies, and delivery issues; coordinate solutions early

- Ensure consistent delivery processes across all active projects



*Client Communication & Coordination

- Serve as the primary delivery point of contact for clients

- Lead client check-ins and status meetings

- Communicate progress, risks, and timelines clearly and professionally

- Build and maintain strong, trust-based client relationships



*Metrics & Reporting

- Serve as the primary delivery point of contact for clients

- Lead client check-ins and status meetings

- Communicate progress, risks, and timelines clearly and professionally

- Build and maintain strong, trust-based client relationships



*Team Facilitation & Agile Support

- Facilitate daily standups, planning sessions, and delivery reviews

- Support lightweight Agile practices appropriate for a small, fast-moving team

- Remove impediments to keep engineering teams focused and productive

- Maintain alignment across engineering and cross-functional stakeholders

- Foster a culture of accountability, clarity, and continuous improvement



*Billing Awareness & Work Authorization

- Maintain visibility into billable vs. non-billable work across projects

- Align delivery efforts with approved scopes, invoices, and payment status

- Ensure work is prioritized based on client authorization and billing readiness

- Coordinate with leadership to confirm which projects or tickets may proceed

- Surface risks related to unpaid, out-of-scope, or unapproved work early



*When sending your application, please use the subject line: Application for Project Coordinator (Scrum/Agile).

*Once your application is received, you may be required to submit a short video introduction. Applicants who are requested to submit, and who complete the video, will be prioritized in the screening process.

title: Youtube Video Editor
description:
Youtube Video Editor (Full-Time)

- $900 per month

- Remote

- Flexible Hours

We are currently seeking a talented video editor to join our team and produce high-quality long form content for our Youtube Channel, which focus on public challenges, fitness, lifestyle, and motivation. The successful candidate should possess strong editing skills, have a deep understanding of how to maximize views and engagement, and have a high level of English, so they can include banter and cultural references in the videos.



We are looking for someone who can create and post multiple Youtube videos per week that typically span from 8 to 30 minutes in run time. The expectation for videos created and posted will vary based channel growth and direction. 



The perfect candidate will be able to create binge-worthy content that keeps viewers engaged, adhere to tight deadlines, and deliver quality work with minimal revisions. They should be organized, communicative, and be able to work quickly. You should be able to deliver items through Frame.io, Capcut, or Google Drive (We will provide access). We expect you to work only with professional video editing software like Adobe Premiere Pro, Capcut, Davinci Resolve, or Final Cut Pro.



You will be paid $900 per month. If you satisfy these requirements and are interested in the position, please apply.





APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:

description:
Elix is a fast-growing, mission-driven company revolutionizing women’s health with natural, personalized solutions rooted in Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) backed by science. We’re seeking a Marketing Operations Associate or Senior Associate to support and optimize our marketing operations. In this role, you’ll play a critical part in managing data-driven projects, tracking campaign performance, and ensuring seamless execution of marketing initiatives. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who values feedback, works independently, and thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. 



Key Responsibilities

- Marketing Project Management:

- Oversee marketing initiatives, ensuring all deliverables are completed on time and meet objectives.

- Manage project timelines and workflows using Asana, keeping the team aligned and accountable.

- Maintain and update marketing calendars, including schedules for
 campaigns, content, and creative assets.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth execution of projects across multiple departments.



Data Analysis & Reporting:

- Track and analyze campaign performance metrics using Google Analytics and other tools.

- Provide actionable insights and recommendations to optimize engagement, conversions, and ROI.

- Generate regular performance reports for stakeholders, highlighting successes and opportunities for improvement.

- Marketing Operations Support:

- Assist in the execution and management of
 campaigns, including scheduling, segmentation, and reporting, using tools like Klaviyo.

- Streamline operational processes to improve efficiency across all marketing functions.

- Ensure all campaigns and materials align with Elix’s focus on data-driven and customer-centered solutions.



Cross-Functional Collaboration:

- Act as a liaison between marketing, product, and other internal teams to align priorities and streamline workflows.

- Participate in tea
etings and strategy sessions to identify opportunities for improved processes and outcomes.

- Proactively communicate project updates, deadlines, and requirements to all stakeholders.



What We’re Looking For

- Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.

- 2-3 years of experience in marketing operations, project management, or analytics (internships included).

- Ability to work 9-5 EST Monday - Friday

- Proficiency in Google Analytics, Asana, and Microsoft Office/Google Workspace.

- Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate actionable insights.

- Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple projects independently.

- Familiarity with
 marketing platforms (e.g., Klaviyo) and basic understanding of marketing tools.

- Effective communication skills, particularly in reporting and cross-functional coordination.

- A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, feedback-driven environment and can manage tasks autonomously.

- Internet speed of around 100 Mbps download speed and 10 Mbps upload speed.



What You’ll Love About Working at Elix:

- Be part of a fast-growing company revolutionizing women’s health and wellness.

- Opportunities for professional growth and development in a mission-driven environment.

- A collaborative team that values open feedback and independent contributions.

- Flexible remote/hybrid work setup to support work-life balance.

- Wellness perks, including access to Elix products and resources.



If you are analytical, organized, and ready to make an impact in marketing operations, we’d love to hear from you. COMPLETE THIS TYPEFORM: 
  to submit your application. 



 Join us at Elix to help drive the future of women’s health!

title: Operations/Admin Assistant for US custom apparel company

title: Construction Assistant (Cost-Focused)
description:
About Us

We are a rapidly growing construction builder and developer based in the San Jose / South Bay Area, backed by AlphaX RE Capital. Our projects range from single-family homes and ADUs to larger community developments. We emphasize precision, efficiency, and strong cost management across every stage of the construction process.



Core Responsibilities (Cost Management Emphasis)

- Assist in preparing project cost budgets, including preliminary estimates, detailed budgets, and cost baselines.

- Perform cost control and dynamic cost tracking, monitoring actual expenditures against planned budgets.

- Prepare regular cost forecasts, variance analyses, and financial reports for project and executive teams.

- Review and analyze bids, subcontractor proposals, and material quotations, supporting cost comparison and value engineering efforts.

- Track and document the cost impact of change orders, maintaining accurate and up-to-date cost logs.

- Support remote coordination of project schedules, budgets, procurement activities, and contract documentation.

- Collaborate virtually with architects, engineers, designers, and contractors to maintain alignment on cost and schedule impacts.



Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

- Strong understanding of construction budgeting, cost control, forecasting, and cost monitoring methodologies.

- Proficient with project management software and remote collaboration platforms.

- Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills.

- Ability to interpret construction drawings and support bid reviews, procurement, and contract management.

- Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Architecture, or a related field.

- 2 years+ of experience in construction cost control, estimating, or project coordination.

- Professional certifications (e.g., PMP, OSHA, cost-related credentials) are a plus.



Preferred Qualifications (not required):

- Familiarity with California building codes, permitting requirements, and construction standards

- Experience using Procore or similar construction management platforms

- Working knowledge of MS Project for cost tracking, reporting, and workflow management

- Chinese language skills



Job Overview

-Remote

-Shift/Schedule:

1) 9:00 am – 5:30 pm (Beijing Time) OR

2) 9:00 am – 5:30 pm (California Time)

Applicants will be asked to indicate which shift they are applying for during the interview process, and the final shift will be determined by the hiring manager.

title: Virtual Transaction Coordinator, Real Estate (Vancouver, BC Team,
description:
The Ali Group is a top producing real estate team in Vancouver, Canada.

We are hiring a full time experienced Virtual Transaction Coordinator to manage listings and sales files from contract to completion in a high volume, compliance focused environment. Preference will be given to someone trained in Vancouver.



This role is transaction and compliance first.

Social media support is secondary.



ROLE SUMMARY



You will be responsible for managing 25 to 40 active files per month and ensuring all listings and transactions are audit ready, accurate and on time.



You will work directly with agents, clients, lawyers and conveyancers.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



• Coordinate residential real estate transactions from listing to completion

• Prepare and manage listing and sale files

• Upload, organize and maintain documents in Skyslope and Google Drive

• Ensure full compliance with BC and REBGV documentation requirements

• Prepare listing documents, disclosures and offer packages

• Upload and maintain listings on MLS, Paragon or Touchbase

• Track subject removals, completions, adjustments and possession dates

• Schedule inspections, appraisals and showings

• Communicate professionally with agents, clients, lawyers and conveyancers

• Maintain accurate file checklists and timelines

• Provide daily file status updates to the team

• Support basic social media posting when required, property posts and simple captions only



PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS



• Zero missed deadlines

• All files audit ready at all times

• Same day document uploads

• Accurate MLS data and listings

• Clean, organized and complete transaction files



REQUIREMENTS



• Minimum 1 year experience as a real estate transaction coordinator or real estate VA

• Comfortable handling multiple active files at the same time

• Strong written and spoken English

• High attention to detail and strong organizational skills

• Reliable high speed internet and home workstation

• Strong working knowledge of Google Workspace

• Able to follow structured systems and checklists



Experience with British Columbia real estate documentation is strongly preferred.



TOOLS YOU WILL USE



• Skyslope

• Google Drive and Google Workspace

• MLS systems such as Paragon or Touchbase

• CRM systems such as Follow Up Boss

• Canva for simple property posts



BONUS SKILLS



• Experience working with Vancouver or Greater Vancouver real estate teams

• Experience with Follow Up Boss, Sisu, Skyslope and Paragon

• Experience preparing listings and offer documentation

• Comfortable posting simple property content to
 and Instagram



WORK DETAILS



• Full time position preferred

• Monday to Friday, aligned with Vancouver time

• Long term role inside a growing real estate team

• Structured systems and training provided



COMPENSATION



Monthly: approximately $1,120.00 - $1,370.00 per month (?63,800 - ?78,000 per month) | Hourly: approximately $7.23 per hour (?412 per hour), based on experience

Performance based raises after the first 90 days

Long term bonuses based on performance and reliability



HOW TO APPLY



Title your application:



Rockstar Transaction Coordinator for Vancouver, Your Name



Include:



• Your resume

• A short summary of your transaction coordination experience

• The software and MLS systems you have used

• One example of how you manage deadlines and file accuracy

• Any real estate coordination or listing management examples you can share



The Ali Group is looking for a long term, detail driven Transaction Coordinator who takes ownership of files and supports a high performance real estate operation.

title: Email Outreach Specialist – Candidate Placement
description:
Stable, growing recruiting firm is seeking a reliable and detail-oriented
 Outreach Specialist to help promote our most placeable candidates to potential employers. In this role, you will be responsible for sending
s on job sites to showcase our candidates. Your focus will be on ensuring the
s are sent accurately and consistently, helping employers see the talent we have ready to place. There is no need to track responses, evaluate candidates, or conduct any recruiting beyond sending the
s — this role is strictly about outbound
 outreach.



This is a stable, long-term opportunity with competitive pay, paid holidays and vacation, and a supportive, people-first culture. You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work day or night, making it a great fit for anyone looking for a role that works around their schedule. Previous experience with
 outreach, recruitment, or lead generation is helpful, but not required — what matters most is being organized, professional, and consistent.



If you take pride in doing work accurately, enjoy straightforward tasks, and want a stable role helping connect great candidates with great opportunities, we’d love to hear from you. This is your chance to be part of a growing team, play an important role in helping people land jobs, and do it on your schedule.

title: Operations Leader (Global, High-Accountability Role)
description:
DAP Brands is seeking a high-level Operations Leader to serve as the Engine Room of our company and turn strategic vision into daily reality.



While the CEO focuses on where we are going, you are responsible for how we get there.



You will oversee the entire operational ecosystem: synchronizing global teams, breaking down silos, and ensuring the business runs like a well-oiled machine. This role is for a leader who thrives behind the scenes, finding satisfaction in flawless execution, optimized workflows, and a scoreboard that consistently shows green.



To be considered for this role, you MUST put: I AM A MAVERICK before your name on our Careers website (
). Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed. Attention to detail is non-negotiable for this role.



What You’ll Own:

- Full operational oversight across departments, teams, and time zones

- Translation of company strategy into clear processes, systems, and execution plans

- End-to-end workflow optimization to eliminate inefficiencies and bottlenecks

- Accountability frameworks, KRIs, dashboards, and scorecards

- Cross-functional alignment between leadership, managers, and frontline teams

- SOP creation, enforcement, and continuous improvement

- Operational cadence: weekly reviews, metrics tracking, execution follow-ups

- Proactive identification of risks, gaps, and execution failures before they escalate



What Success Looks Like:

- Teams execute consistently without micromanagement

- Deadlines are hit, priorities are clear, and handoffs are seamless

- Metrics are visible, tracked, and improving month over month

- The CEO spends less time fixing execution issues and more time scaling the business

- Operations run smoothly even in high-pressure, fast-growth periods



Who We’re Looking For:

- Proven operations leader with experience managing complex, multi-team environments

- Strong systems thinker who naturally spots inefficiencies and fixes them

- Highly organized, decisive, and execution-obsessed

- Comfortable holding people accountable: calm, fair, and firm

- Excellent communicator who can align teams without drama

- Experience working with global or remote teams is a strong plus



This Role Is NOT For You If:

- You prefer strategy discussions over execution

- You avoid difficult conversations or accountability

- You need constant direction instead of owning outcomes

- You’re uncomfortable with metrics, dashboards, and performance tracking



Why Join DAP Brands?

- Work directly with a visionary CEO and leadership team

- High-impact role with real authority and ownership

- Opportunity to build and scale world-class operational systems

- Performance-driven culture that values results over noise

title: Shopify Web Developer - CRO Specialist - Ecommerce Advertising Agency - Full Time 2b
description:
APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED: 





CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.



Note: All Remote Employees Must Be Available To Work During The Following Business Hours:

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST



Roles & Responsibilities

- Develop landing pages using Figma and various WYSYWIG editors including but not limited to Replo and Pagefly.

- Edit product, collection and other page templates using Shopify Liquid template engine, and various HTML/CSS frameworks.

- Install various checkout/tracking applications (aftersell, Zipify OCU, Upstack, etc)

- Install various applications for product bundling when needed, and create product bundles. 

- Install tracking pixels on client’s websites

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more. 

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

- Strong verbal and written English language skills (American Dialect)

- Strong knowledge of HTML/CSS/Javascript/Shopify Liquid required. 

- Knowledge of Python and Ruby preferred but not required.

- 1+ years of web development (Shopify) experience required

- 1+ years of backend python (flask/django) development experience preferred but not required

- 1+ years of marketing agency experience preferred but not required

- Must be highly organized and possess strong attention to detail

- All applicants are encouraged to apply, regardless of experience or education



APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED:

title: Executive Assistant (Real Estate & Operations) — Full-Time, Long-Term
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE:

I’m a U.S.-based real estate investor and operator building a purpose-driven housing company with long-term growth plans. I’m looking for a full-time Executive Assistant who is highly organized, proactive, and thoughtful – someone who enjoys creating order out of chaos, improving systems, and growing alongside a business.



This is an early-stage venture, so some initial tasks may be general operational work and occasionally less structured as we clarify workflows together. Over time, as we build trust and clarity, this role will evolve into deeper involvement in planning, systems, and decision support.



If you’re someone who likes to take initiative, think one step ahead, and help a business run better – not just faster – this role may be a great fit.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Assist with
 marketing, outreach, and response tracking

* Research and recommend apps, tools, and systems to improve efficiency

* Create, document, and maintain Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)

* Support basic website setup and updates (Squarespace)

* Assist with real estate–related tasks (research, coordination, documentation)

* Track follow-ups, deadlines, open loops, anticipate upcoming needs, and suggest improvements

* Adapt to evolving tasks and workflows, helping define processes as the business grows



REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALITIES:

* Near-native American English proficiency (written/spoken)

* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and dependable

* Proactive and solution-oriented: you notice gaps and suggest fixes instead of waiting for a list

* Strong follow-through and time-management skills

* Comfortable taking instructions, asking clarifying questions, and learning quickly

* Honest, accountable, and willing to own mistakes and learn from them

* Resourceful and calm under ambiguity

* Able to work with discretion and confidentiality

* Comfortable in a fast-changing, early-stage environment where some tasks may be initially vague



EXPERIENCE & TOOLS:

* Experience supporting U.S.-based clients (California-specific context is a major plus)

* Familiarity with the world of real estate or strong interest in learning

* Property management experience is a strong plus, including familiarity with U.S. rental platforms such as Furnished Finder, TurboTenant, Zillow, Redfin, or similar tools used by landlords and property managers

* Expert in Google Workspace and comfortable leveraging AI tools like ChatGPT or Gemini to work smarter

* Research, data entry, and tracking tasks

* Experience creating or maintaining SOPs

* Must have a reliable high-speed internet connection and a backup power solution (please specify in your application)



WORK SCHEDULE & COMPENSATION:

* Full-time: 40 hours per week

* Shift: Partial overlap with U.S. business hours required (minimum 2 hours overlap with PST)

* $5–6 USD/hour, commensurate with experience and capabilities



GROWTH & FUTURE OPPORTUNITIES:

This is a long-term role with the opportunity to take on more responsibility as the business grows. Exceptional performance, initiative, and reliability will be recognized with expanded scope and the potential for increased compensation over time. You’ll have the chance to shape processes, systems, and the way we operate, making a real impact on the company’s growth.



HOW TO APPLY:

Please include:

* Change the subject line of your application to: "Real Estate EA - [Your Favorite Hobby]"

* A brief introduction and your relevant experience with U.S. clients

* A specific example of when you were proactive and solved a problem before your boss asked

* Your current ID Proof score from OnlineJobs.ph

* Your internet speed and backup plan for power/internet outages



FINAL NOTE:

I value integrity, clarity, and long-term thinking. I’m looking for someone dependable, thoughtful, and eager to grow with the business, comfortable with the early-stage reality where some tasks may be evolving or initially unclear.

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
About Us



At DLT, we optimize the customer–agent relationship for maximum efficiency and effectiveness, driving measurable growth and increasing revenue for our agents. With over 15 years in business, we’ve built a reputation for raising the service standard in the freight industry. Our “Dream Team” supports independent freight agents by handling the back-office work so they can focus on what they do best—growing their business.



The Role



As a Customer Support Specialist (CSS), you’ll be the backbone of our agent support system. You’ll manage quoting, booking, tracking, and customer communication while ensuring every shipment moves smoothly. You’ll play a direct role in protecting revenue for our agents and delivering exceptional customer service that sets us apart.



Key Responsibilities



Manage shipment lifecycle from quote to delivery



Provide timely, professional communication with agents, carriers, and customers



Proactively track and trace shipments, resolving exceptions quickly



Audit and resolve billing or invoicing discrepancies



Document processes and follow SOPs to maintain high service standards



Collaborate with your team lead and fellow Dream Tea
mbers to support agent growth



What We’re Looking For:



Experience: 1–3 years in logistics, freight, or transportation preferred



Skills: Strong communication, attention to detail, ability to multitask



Mindset: Agent-centered thinking, problem solver, thrives in a fast-paced environment



Tech: Proficient in transportation management systems (TMS),
, and Microsoft/Google Workspace tools



Culture Fit: Team player who values professionalism, accountability, and growth



Why Join DLT?



Remote-first work environment



Supportive leadership and collaborative team culture



Opportunity to learn, grow, and advance within a scaling company



Competitive pay and performance-based bonuses



Be part of a company that values partnership, excellence, and innovation in the logistics industry

title: VIRTUAL ASSISTANT EXPERT AT GOOGLE SHEETS
description:
We are a Texas based roofing company looking for a virtual assistant that can perform basic administrative tasks in Mojo Dialer and JobNimbus, and needs to be an expert at using Google Sheets to track data and pull information for us.



DURING THE INTERVIEW YOU WILL BE SHARED A GOOGLE SHEET AND BE ASKED TO PULL INSIGHTS FROM IT LIVE ON THE CALL - AND USE IT GO CREATE NEW SPREADSHEETS BASED ON THAT INFORMATION. 



Additional time may be spent cold calling, if you have a good American accent. 



SCHEDULE:

Hours: 40+ hrs/week, Monday-Friday 8AM–11AM CST, a 4 hour break and then again 3PM-8PM CST.



The pay is $4/hour + $150 commission on sold jobs for the extra time that you will have to cold call. 



WE ARE ONLY HIRING COLD CALLERS THAT HAVE A PERFECT ENGLISH ACCENT AND ABLE TO COMMUNICATE WELL.

WE WILL ONLY INTERVIEW APPLICANTS THAT SEND IN A 30 SECOND VIDEO INTRODUCING THEMSELVES FIRST.



Requirements:

Experience using Mojo, JobNimbus and Google Sheets. 



Daily tasks will include updating and maintaining information in Mojo (our dialing software), JobNimbus (our CRM) and being an expert at managing data and providing insights into our Google Sheets data that we keep track of. 



We are conducting interviews on a regular basis and looking for people that can start immediately if they are accepted through the interview process.



-Graham

Veteran Roofing

title: Appointment Setter / Sales Outreach – Contact List Provided
description:
My client is looking for a reliable Outbound Sales Outreach Specialist to contact a list of potential customers we already have and see if they’re interested in purchasing mulch for $12 per yard.



You will be reaching out to people on our list by phone (depending on your strengths and our process), asking a few qualification questions, and helping move interested leads toward a sale. This role is perfect for someone who is comfortable talking to customers, following a script, and tracking results carefully.



We pay an hourly base + performance bonus for sales that result from your outreach.



What you’ll do:



Contact leads from our provided list (no cold list building required)



Use our script and messaging templates (and help improve them over time)



Identify interest, answer basic questions, and gather key details (location, quantity needed, timing, etc.)



Log every interaction clearly in our tracker/CRM (Google Sheets)



Follow up with warm leads until they buy or decline



Coordinate handoff or scheduling with our team when needed



What we’re looking for



Strong English communication (spoken and written)



Experience with outbound calling, appointment setting, or sales outreach



Confident on the phone and professional (not pushy)



Organized: you can keep accurate notes and maintain follow-up reminders



Reliable internet + quiet workspace for calls



Comfortable working with a US-based team and reporting results



Bonus points if you have:



Landscaping/home services lead outreach experience



Familiarity with CRM/spreadsheets, follow-up systems, and sales KPIs



For top consideration please record yourself reading the script below and submit it to this form: 







Script to read: 

"“Hi, is this Paul?

Hi Paul, my name is [Your Name] calling from Mulch Discount Sales. I’m reaching out because one of our partners is offering mulch at $12 per yard and I wanted to see if you’d be interested in placing an order this week or next."

title: A2P Specialist
description:
We are looking to bring a Gohighlevel A2P Specialist onto our team. Your only role is to create and then maintain a snapshot for A2P submission. We bring about 3 new clients onboard a week, and that number is steadily increasing. Your job is to setup A2P and get each new client verified. We expect the new clients to have their A2P submitted the same business day. You do not have set hours but we expect you to be available Monday-Friday at least.

You will be compensated based on the submission results:

$40 - Client Approved (Brand & Campaign) on First Attempt and Submission Attempt was made within 12 Hours (Monday-Friday)

$15 -  Client Approved on Second Attempt and Submission was made within 36 Hours (Monday-Friday)

title: Capcut / TikTok Editor
description:
Part-time Capcut / TikTok Editor with potential for more



Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor



You will be making TikTok videos using Capcup (preferred but not necessary) or the video editing software of your choice.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:

- Cutting dead space in talking head videos

- Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

- Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.

- Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the audio with corresponding footage

-

- STRONG English

- Strong internet connection

- Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

$300/month + bonuses for 2-3h a day MAX and potential full time work in the future with a salary increase.

title: Mental Health Patient Care Coordinator
description:
Job Title: Mental Health Patient Care Coordinator

Position type: Full-Time

Work hours: 8:30 AM to 4:30 PM Pacific Standard Time

Work days: Monday to Friday





Scope of Work & Key Responsibilities

Core Responsibilities

-Maintain and update patient records

-Handle patient inquiries and correspondence with empathy and professionalism

-Support claims processing and insurance verification

-Assist with billing support

-Prepare and organize documents, including reports, presentations, and spreadsheets



Delegated Task Areas:

-Scheduling & Patient Confirmations

-Schedule new and existing patient appointments in DrChrono

-Confirm appointments via calls, texts, and
s

-Send appointment reminders

-Maintain a backup/waitlist to fill cancellations and reduce no-shows

-Flag recurring no-show patterns to the clinic manager or provider



Eligibility Checks & Insurance Verification (Same-Day)

-Run eligibility verification the same day patient information is received

-Verify basic benefits and coverage required for scheduling

-Document results in the EMR or tracker

-Flag issues quickly for the clinical or admin team



Prior Authorizations (Support Role)

-Submit prior authorization requests using existing clinic templates and processes

-Track authorization status and follow up until determination

-Maintain a clean tracker (status, dates, next steps)

-Escalate urgent or delayed authorizations appropriately



Billing Support (Light)

-Work from the clinic’s existing patient balance list

-Contact patients with outstanding balances in a polite, compliant manner

-Send payment links and confirm amounts owed based on provided billing records

-Log outcomes clearly (paid, promised, needs follow-up, dispute) and follow up as needed (this role does not manage full -billing operations or payer contracting.)



Coding Support (Very Light & Tentative)

-Use the clinic’s limited, approved mental health code list

-Double-check data-entry accuracy before claims are sent to the billing team

 (This is not a coder role and does not involve independent coding decisions.)





Required Experience & Skills

-Prior U.S. healthcare administrative experience (strongly preferred)

-Experience as a Medical Receptionist, Medical Admin Assistant, Patient Care Coordinator, or Medical Billing Specialist

-EMR experience required (DrChrono preferred; trainable if experienced with other EMRs)

-Experience with VOIP Systems

-Experience using Microsoft Office programs

-Comfortable with patient-facing phone calls, especially in a mental health setting

-Polite, patient, empathetic, calm, and professional communication style

-Highly detail-oriented, organized, and self-directed

-Able to work independently and manage multiple workflows reliably

-Must be comfortable speaking with patients and communicating warmly, respectfully, and empathetically in a mental health environment



Top 3 Priorities

1. Scheduling & confirmations, including managing a backup list to reduce gaps from cancellations/no-shows

2. Same-day eligibility checks and prior authorization support

3. Patient billing follow-ups, including sending payment links and documenting outcomes



Success Metrics (KPIs)

-Faster, smoother scheduling flow with fewer calendar gaps

-Same-day completion of eligibility checks

-Consistent follow-through on prior authorizations

-Regular, documented outreach on patient balances

-Clear tracking and communication across all assigned workflows



Must-Have Capabilities

-Support scheduling, confirmations, eligibility verification, and prior authorizations

-Comfortable with light billing follow-ups

-Understand that coding support is very limited and focused only on accuracy checks





How to Apply?

-Send me a google drive link containing your resume. Make sure public and it's accessible so I can view it.

title: Paid Media & Social Media Manager - Meta Ads, Tiktok Ads & UGC ( Beauty Brand )
description:
bout Taiff NYC



Taiff NYC is the official U.S. presence of Taiff Brasil — a premium professional hair tools brand trusted by top stylists. Our products are used in salons, masterclasses, and professional settings, and our brand positioning is luxury, performance, and education-driven.



We are expanding aggressively across Meta and TikTok and are looking for a skilled Paid Media & Social Media Manager who understands content, ads, and creator-driven growth.



This is NOT an entry-level role.



---



What You’ll Be Responsible For



• Manage Instagram,
, and TikTok accounts

• Create and manage Meta Ads (Instagram &
)

• Create and manage TikTok Ads

• Work with UGC creators (outreach, briefs, coordination)

• Review, select, and optimize creator content for ads

• Create high-quality social graphics (Canva / Adobe)

• Assist with short-form video editing

• Build and manage a monthly content calendar

• Write captions and ad copy that converts

• Analyze performance and suggest improvements

• Help scale winning creatives and ads



---



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY)



• Proven experience running Meta Ads

• Proven experience running TikTok Ads

• Experience working with UGC creators

• Strong understanding of short-form video

• Graphic design experience (Canva, Adobe, or similar)

• Excellent English communication

• Organized, proactive, and reliable



Applicants without paid ads experience will NOT be considered.



---



PORTFOLIO REQUIRED



When applying, include:



• Ad accounts or campaigns you’ve managed (screenshots acceptable)

• Social media accounts you manage or have managed

• Video ads or UGC examples

• Graphic design samples

• Beauty, hair, or cosmetics experience (preferred but not required)



Applications without proof of experience will be skipped.



---



What Success Looks Like



• Consistent content output

• High-performing ad creatives

• Clear communication with creators

• Improved engagement and conversions

• Strong brand consistency



We are looking for someone who understands branding + performance, not just posting.



---



Compensation



• Full-Time: $700/month



Long-term role for the right person.



---



How to Apply



Start your application with the word “TAIFF” so we know you read everything.



Then answer:



1. What ad budgets have you managed before?

2. Which platform do you prefer: Meta or TikTok — and why?

3. What tools do you use for ads, design, and video?

4. Have you worked with UGC creators before? Explain how.



We’re looking for someone who wants to grow with the brand.

title: Marketing and Design Specialist
description:
We are seeking a Creative "Hunter"—a high-output professional who combines artistic excellence with strategic marketing execution. This is not an admin role; this is a growth role. You will report directly to the CEO, serving as the creative engine of the organization. Your job is to take the CEO's vision and instantly translate it into stunning visuals,

high-converting funnels, and compelling narratives.



The "Big 3" Priorities

1. World-Class Design: You don't just use templates; you create brand experiences using Canva and Photoshop.

2. Funnel Architecture: You know how to build systems 
 + Social) that turn followers into donors/supporters.

3. High-Level Communication: You articulate ideas clearly and professionally. You are ready to speak with the CEO every single day.





Key Responsibilities

.

* Strategic Sounding Board: Act as a thinking partner to the CEO, offering creative solutions to organizational challenges.

Who You Are

title: A+ Player: Media Buyer (Google/Meta)
description:
Please read the WHOLE post & if you think you're a fit - send us a message showing us you read it without using AI.

We pay above market, so read the whole thing and do not use AI.



**Bulldogs Core Philosophy**

- Simple Scales, Complex Fails

- Build The People & The People Build The Business

- Be The Example



This role is designed for an experienced, results-driven media buyer who can own paid acquisition from setup to optimization across
 Ads and Google Ads. The ideal candidate will work closely with the CEO to build out ad accounts, landing pages, and full campaign infrastructure - then manage performance on an ongoing basis.



We hire for the "Soul" and train for the "Role".



---



**Primary Responsibilities**



**Ad Account Setup & Campaign Management**

- Build out
 Business Manager and Google Ads accounts from scratch

- Create campaign structures, ad sets/ad groups, audiences, and conversion tracking (Pixel, CAPI, Google Tag Manager, etc.).

- Develop and launch campaigns aligned with lead generation and data monetization objectives.

- Manage daily budgets, bid strategies, and pacing across platforms.



**Landing Page Development**

- Design, build, and optimize landing pages for paid traffic using tools such as GoHighLevel or similar.

- Implement A/B testing on headlines, CTAs, form fields, and page layouts.

- Ensure landing pages are mobile-responsive, fast-loading, and compliant with platform ad policies.



**Tracking, Analytics & Reporting**

- Set up end-to-end conversion tracking including UTM parameters, pixel events, and offline conversion imports.

- Deliver weekly performance reports with clear insights and recommended next steps.

- Monitor KPIs: CPL, CPA, CTR, ROAS, and lead quality metrics.

- Track creative performance to identify which ad styles, hooks, and formats drive the best results.



**Creative & Copy Support**

- Write or brief ad copy and creative variations for testing.

- Coordinate with designers or use Canva/similar tools for ad creative production.

- Stay current on platform policy changes, algorithm updates, and creative best practices.

- Research trending ad formats across platforms to keep creative fresh and competitive.



**Process Improvement & SOP Development**

- Document campaign workflows and standard operating procedures using Loom (video-based SOPs) or similar tools.

- Identify inefficiencies in the ad-to-lead pipeline and suggest automation or workflow improvements.

- Show us you read up until here - prepare a message with the words "I am a superstar".



**Client & Vendor Coordination**

- Communicate with internal tea
mbers to ensure smooth integration.

- Attend key calls, document takeaways, and ensure follow-ups are logged and executed.



---



**Ideal Candidate Profile**

- **Proven Media Buying Experience:** Minimum 2 years running
 and/or Google Ads campaigns with demonstrable results in lead generation.

- **Full-Funnel Thinker:** You don't just launch ads - you understand the entire journey from click to conversion and optimize accordingly.

- **Landing Page Capable:** Comfortable building and iterating on landing pages without needing a developer.

- **Data-Driven:** You make decisions based on numbers, not gut feelings. Comfortable pulling reports and pivoting strategy based on performance.

- **Self-Starter & Problem-Solver:** Can proactively identify what's underperforming and take action without excessive hand-holding.

- **Strong Communication Skills:** Ability to work with executives, vendors, and clients professionally.

- **Flexible & Adaptable:** When a platform changes its rules overnight, you adjust and keep moving. Willingness to learn, take ownership, and operate in a fast-paced environment.

- **See the Big Picture:** You connect daily campaign optimizations to long-term company growth objectives.

- **Deliver with Urgency:** You bring focus and energy to hit launch dates and performance targets.



---



**Preferred Experience & Tools**

- **Ad Platforms:**
 Ads Manager, Google Ads, TikTok Ads (bonus)

- **Landing Pages:** GoHighLevel, ClickFunnels, Unbounce, WordPress/Elementor, Leadpages

- **Tracking & Analytics:** Google Analytics (GA4), Google Tag Manager,
 Pixel/CAPI, Hyros or similar attribution tools

- **Collaboration:** Slack,
, Zoom, Loom



---



**Position Type & Availability**

- Part-Time & Gig to start with potential to grow into a larger role as volume scales.

- Must be available to work within U.S. Eastern Time (EST) for check-ins and collaboration windows.

- Remote position with regular communication cadence and real-time responsiveness expected.



---



**Why This Role Matters**



The company is in a growth phase, and this role is critical to building out a paid acquisition engine that generates high-quality leads at scale. We're not looking for someone who just "boosts posts" - we want a strategic operator who builds campaigns with intention, tests relentlessly, and treats our ad spend like it's their own money. Show me you read the entire description - continue your message to us with the words "details count". High attention to detail and accuracy will impress us.

s after hours

title: Video Editor needed for regular, ongoing work
description:
THE COMPANY

Avalon Creative Group is a dynamic and innovative company headquartered in the heart of the San Francisco Bay Area and Silicon Valley in California. We specialize in the creation of captivating and immersive content for corporate clients, offering comprehensive content design, production, and creative services. Working with Avalon Creative Group presents an exciting opportunity for individuals seeking to collaborate with renowned brands, while also offering a continuous learning environment that fosters personal and professional growth.



JOB DESCRIPTION

Avalon Creative Group is seeking a talented and experienced video editor and 3D animator based in the Philippines to work with us as an independent contractor. Our work includes videos to inspire audiences at corporate events, on-demand marketing webinars, internal corporate training and sales enablement, product demos, highlight reels, social media ads, interviews, customer testimonials and more.



Our goal is to establish a long term working relationship with a creative, reliable and ambitious video professional. After successfully completing an initial trial period, the right person will become an integral member of our creative team on a full-time contract basis.



RESPONSIBILITIES

> Edit high quality videos from a variety of sources, including single-camera, multi-camera, stock footage, AI generated video, graphic elements, music, sound effects, etc.

> Understand and apply corporate branding and style guidelines and templates (MOGRTs)

> Manage, organize and backup video assets and deliverables, including raw footage, graphics, sound files, stock footage, projects, files, etc.

> Adhere to budgeted time constraints while incorporating client feedback and changes through multiple rounds of review and revisions

> Contribute to and consistently apply efficient workflow processes and standards (SOPs)

> Document guidelines and process details for tea

title: Internal Accountant (Confidential - Non-client role)
description:
Internal Accountant (Confidential - Non-Client Role)

Remote | Philippines | Long-term contract | Part-time (15–25 hrs/week)



About the Role



We are a growing professional services company seeking a highly trustworthy and detail-oriented accountant to manage the company’s internal books and financial records.



This is not a client accounting role and you will not be part of the delivery team.



You will work directly with ownership to keep the company’s finances organized, accurate, and audit-ready.



Because this position handles sensitive company information, discretion and professionalism are essential.



This role suits someone who prefers stable, predictable accounting work and long-term responsibility rather than high-volume client deadlines.



Responsibilities



Own bookkeeping and monthly close in QuickBooks Online



Reconcile multiple bank and credit card accounts monthly



Reconcile payroll and related clearing accounts



Manage clearing and suspense accounts (transfers, payroll, timing differences)



Record contractor payments and owner distributions



Maintain accruals and prepaid schedules



Calculate monthly GST/HST payable and ITCs (no filing required)



Attach supporting documentation to every transaction at the transaction level in QuickBooks Online



Maintain organized receipt documentation



Prepare monthly financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow) by the 10th of every month



Maintain equity, dividends schedules and retained earnings balances



Identify discrepancies and request clarification when needed



Proactively follow up with the founder for missing information or documentation



Prepare a monthly reporting package for ownership review and answer questions



Identify trends, concerns, and areas of the financials the founders should keep an eye on



Communication Expectations



This role requires proactive communication.



Maintain a running list of open questions



Follow up for missing receipts or unclear transactions



Do not wait until month-end to raise issues



Help keep the books complete by consistently prompting for information



You are not managing people — you are helping ownership stay organized.



Documentation Standard (Important)



All transactions must have supporting documentation attached directly within QuickBooks Online.



This requires careful review and consistent time investment each month.



The role prioritizes completeness and accuracy over speed.



Applicants should only apply if comfortable performing detailed documentation work as a core responsibility of the position.



What This Role Is NOT



No client bookkeeping



No tax filings or CRA submissions



No customer meetings



No external deadlines (internal only)



No supervision of staff



This is a quiet, focused accounting role supporting one company internally.



Requirements



Certified Public Accountant in the PH



4+ years bookkeeping/accounting experience



Experience handling the full cycle accounting for a professional services firm



Strong QuickBooks Online experience (required)



Experience reconciling payroll and clearing accounts



Experience with Canadian GST/HST calculations preferred, or willing to learn



Strong understanding of accrual accounting



Comfortable maintaining audit-ready documentation



Willing to attach documentation to every transaction consistently



Comfortable proactively following up for missing information



High attention to detail and consistency



Comfortable handling confidential financial information



Able to work independently and ask clear questions



Reliable internet and stable availability, with some crossover in EST timezone (no set hours)



Ideal Candidate



You prefer organized, consistent accounting work



You are dependable and careful



You double-check your work before submitting



You work well independently



You are comfortable working quietly in the background



You value long-term stability over fast promotions



Compensation



PHP 75,000 – 120,000 per month equivalent (depending on experience and hours)



Stable long-term role with predictable workload and minimal overtime.



How to Apply



Please include:



Your resume



A short message describing your experience reconciling payroll and accruals



Confirmation you are comfortable attaching documentation to every transaction



Your QuickBooks Online experience level



Your expected monthly compensation



Applicants who do not follow instructions will not be considered.

title: Social Media Graphic Designer
description:
About Detour Studios



Detour Studios is a young, fast-growing creative agency based in Montreal. We’re a fun, dynamic team working with a wide range of clients from e-commerce brands and startups to gyms, restaurants, supplement companies, and more. No two days look the same, and that’s exactly what excites us. Our environment is flexible, fast-paced, and full of opportunities to grow.





The Role



We’re looking for a Social Media Graphic Designer who can create minimal, clean, and effective social media graphics for our clients mainly Instagram carousel posts (and occasional story graphics). 



You won’t be responsible for strategy or copywriting we provide the strategy, structure, and copy. Your job is to turn that into scroll-stopping, retention-friendly designs that feel on-brand and are built for performance (likes, saves, shares, and completion rate).





What You’ll Do

 • Design Instagram carousel graphics using the copy + direction we provide

 • Create simple, clean, on-brand layouts (minimal design, strong hierarchy, readable typography)

 • Apply brand guidelines (fonts, colors, logo usage) and keep visuals consistent

 • Build graphics that support retention (strong cover slide, clear progression, punchy formatting)

 • Deliver final exports in the right formats (IG carousel, stories, etc.)

 • Iterate quickly based on feedback from our team

 • Manage files and stay organized across multiple client brands

 • Stay current with social design trends (carousel structure, hook formats, readability, etc.)





What We’re Looking For

 • Experience creating social media graphics (portfolio required)

 • Strong proficiency in Canva and Adobe (Illustrator/Photoshop)

 • Good understanding of social-first design principles (hooks, readability, pacing across slides)

 • Ability to take structured direction and execute fast

 • Clean design taste you know how to make “simple” look premium

 • Detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable in a fast-paced environment

 • Bonus: experience working with agencies and multiple brand styles





Why Join Detour?

 • Be part of a young, creative, and energetic team

 • Work across exciting clients in multiple industries

 • Real opportunities to grow inside a rapidly expanding agency

 • Fun, flexible, and collaborative work environment





Ready to Take the Detour?

Apply now with your portfolio + CV.

title: VA Specialist
description:
I am looking for a full-time VA Specialist to provide floating support across our Call Center, Front Desk, and Billing teams. This role is for someone who is highly adaptable and experienced in the full patient lifecycle within a physical therapy or outpatient clinic setting, from check-in through billing and insurance processing.



I need someone who can step in wherever support is needed and help keep daily clinic operations running smoothly.



What I’m looking for you to do:



- Provide cross-functional support for absent staff in the Call Center, Front Desk/Reception, and Billing

- Manage patient check-ins and check-outs, appointment scheduling, and patient communication

- Verify insurance eligibility and benefits

- Handle authorizations, referrals, and related documentation

- Manage billing tasks such as claims submission, follow-ups, and handling denials

- Maintain accurate documentation in EMRs and insurance portals

- Navigate authorization platforms and payer systems efficiently

- Ensure confidentiality and compliance with all patient and billing records

- Adapt daily to changing department needs to support clinic workflow continuity



What I’m looking for in you:



- At least 2+ years of experience in medical billing, front desk operations, or healthcare administration

- Experience in a physical therapy or outpatient clinic is strongly preferred

- Strong end-to-end billing knowledge, including:

- Patient check-ins

- Insurance verification

- Authorizations and referrals

- Claims submission and follow-ups

- Proficiency with EMR systems, insurance portals, authorization platforms, and billing/patient management software

- Strong communication, organization, and multitasking skills

- Comfortable working in a floating role with changing daily assignments

- Available to work 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM PST, 40 hours per week



Apply here:

title: A+ Player: Video Editor
description:
Please read the WHOLE post & if you think you're a fit - send us a message showing us you read it without using AI.

We pay above market, so read the whole thing and do not use AI.



**Bulldogs Core Philosophy**

- Simple Scales, Complex Fails

- Build The People & The People Build The Business

- Be The Example



This role is designed for an experienced, creative video editor who can produce high-quality video content that drives paid ad performance. The ideal candidate will work closely with the CEO and media buying team to create scroll-stopping video ad creatives across multiple platforms - then iterate and optimize based on performance data.



We hire for the "Soul" and train for the "Role".



---



**Primary Responsibilities**



**Video Editing & Ad Creative Production**

- Edit and produce short-form video ads optimized for
, Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok placements.

- Create multiple variations of video creatives for A/B testing (hooks, CTAs, lengths, formats).

- Work with raw footage, screen recordings, stock video, and AI-generated content to produce polished ad creatives.

- Add captions/subtitles, motion graphics, text overlays, and branded elements to video content.

- Repurpose long-form content (webinars, interviews, walkthroughs) into short-form ad clips and social content.

- Understand platform-specific video specs (aspect ratios, durations, safe zones) and optimize accordingly.

- Maintain an organized library of video assets, templates, and brand elements for rapid creative iteration.



**Creative & Copy Support**

- Write or brief ad copy and creative variations for testing.

- Coordinate with the media buying team to align creative with campaign objectives and audience targeting.

- Stay current on platform policy changes, algorithm updates, and creative best practices.

- Research trending ad formats and video styles across platforms to keep creative fresh and competitive.

- Show us you read up until here - prepare a message with the words "I am a superstar".



**Performance Tracking & Creative Optimization**

- Track creative performance to identify which video styles, hooks, and formats drive the best results.

- Use performance data to inform creative decisions and iterate on winning concepts.

- Deliver regular creative reports highlighting top performers and recommendations for next tests.



**Process Improvement & SOP Development**

- Document video production workflows and standard operating procedures using Loom (video-based SOPs) or similar tools.

- Identify inefficiencies in the creative production process and suggest automation or workflow improvements.



**Team Coordination**

- Communicate with internal tea
mbers to ensure smooth integration between creative and media buying.

- Attend key calls, document takeaways, and ensure follow-ups are logged and executed.



---



**Ideal Candidate Profile**

- **Skilled Video Editor:** You can take raw footage and turn it into scroll-stopping ad creatives quickly and efficiently. You have an eye for pacing, hooks, and what makes people stop scrolling.

- **Performance-Minded Creative:** You don't just make things look good - you understand that the goal is conversions and you optimize creative accordingly.

- **Data-Driven:** You pay attention to which creatives perform and use that data to inform your next edits. Comfortable reviewing performance reports and pivoting based on results.

- **Self-Starter & Problem-Solver:** Can proactively identify what's underperforming creatively and take action without excessive hand-holding.

- **Strong Communication Skills:** Ability to work with executives, vendors, and clients professionally.

- **Flexible & Adaptable:** When a platform changes its specs or a new format trends overnight, you adjust and keep moving. Willingness to learn, take ownership, and operate in a fast-paced environment.

- **See the Big Picture:** You connect daily creative output to long-term company growth objectives.

- **Deliver with Urgency:** You bring focus and energy to hit creative deadlines and campaign launch dates.



---



**Preferred Experience & Tools**

- **Video Editing:** CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, DaVinci Resolve, or Final Cut Pro

- **Motion Graphics & Design:** Canva, Figma, or basic Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator)

- **Ad Platforms (familiarity):**
 Ads Manager, Google Ads, TikTok Ads - understanding of ad specs and placement requirements

- **Collaboration:** Slack,
, Zoom, Loom



---



**Position Type & Availability**

- Part-Time & Gig to start with potential to grow into a larger role as volume scales.

- Must be available to work within U.S. Eastern Time (EST) for check-ins and collaboration windows.

- Remote position with regular communication cadence and real-time responsiveness expected.



---



**Why This Role Matters**



The company is in a growth phase, and this role is critical to producing the video creative that powers our paid acquisition engine. We're not looking for someone who just slaps text on stock footage - we want a creative operator who produces content with intention, tests relentlessly, and understands that great creative is the #1 lever in paid advertising. Show me you read the entire description - continue your message to us with the words "details count". High attention to detail and accuracy will impress us.



This is an opportunity to be part of something exciting, have a direct impact on revenue, and grow alongside the business.



---



**Things we look for when evaluating candidates:**

- Fast response times

- Detail-oriented

- Follows instructions

- No need to chase

- Owns their teeth (takes ownership of their role)

- Competent

- Honest

- Smart

- Spelling / Grammar

- Good natured

- Responds to
s after hours

- Goes over and above to learn / grow

- An autodidact that can handle self-learning projects

title: Administrative & Customer Support Assistant
description:
ROLE OVERVIEW

This role is ideal for a detail-oriented, tech-capable admin professional who thrives in structured work, enjoys keeping businesses organized, and can confidently support invoicing and customer follow-up processes. They will need strong operational instincts, comfort with invoicing systems, and the ability to learn new tools quickly.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Invoicing & Accounts Support:

- Input invoices into Sage (or similar accounting system)

- Process, monitor, and track incoming cash receipts

- Follow up on late payments and overdue invoices

- Email invoices to customers daily or weekly based on schedule

- Maintain clean records of billing and payment status



Client Communication & Quote Follow-Up

- Support customer service via email communication

- Follow up with clients on outstanding quotes and pending approvals

- Ensure no client requests or proposals fall through the cracks

- Help the team stay responsive while protecting their time



Administrative Organization

- Organize inbox workflows and manage calendar scheduling

- Assist with appointment coordination, reminders, and task tracking

- Build repeatable systems for day-to-day admin operations



Systems & Tech Support (Critical Need)

- Assist in evaluating and selecting a new Operating System/software platform

- Help port administrative processes into updated tools

- Improve internal workflows through automation, templates, and structure

- Comfortable working across Google Workspace, CRMs, invoicing tools, and new platforms



IDEAL CANDIDATE PROFILE

- Extremely organized and detail-oriented

- Confident handling invoicing, billing support, and client follow-up

- Tech-savvy and comfortable learning new systems quickly

- Proactive — doesn’t wait to be told what’s broken

- Strong written communicator with a professional customer-facing tone

- Experienced supporting small business owners or operations teams



PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

- Admin support, customer support, or operations assistance

- Familiarity with invoicing/accounting tools (Sage is a plus)

- Experience helping companies implement new software or workflows

- VA experience supporting U.S.-based service businesses



SUCCESS IN THIS ROLE LOOKS LIKE

- Invoices go out consistently and on time

- Late payments are tracked and followed up systematically

- Client quote follow-up becomes reliable and automated

- Calendar, inbox, and admin workload feel under control

- The organization transitions smoothly into stronger systems and operating structure



HOURS & COMPENSATION

- Starting at 10~20 hours/week

- Opportunity to expand into a long-term operations support role

- Competitive compensation based on experience and technical skill

description:
DAP Brands is seeking a detail-oriented, technically savvy, and solution-driven Integrations Associate to support our mission of building seamless, scalable automations across the organization. This role goes beyond task execution. You’ll work closely with our Technology Integration Manager to design, maintain, and optimize workflows that improve efficiency across Sales, Marketing, and Operations.



If you enjoy connecting systems, solving process gaps, and leveraging automation tools to create reliable, intelligent workflows, this role is for you.



Key Responsibilities:

- Integration Setup & Maintenance: Assist in setting up, testing, launching, and maintaining integrations using platforms such as Zapier, Make, and GoHighLevel. Monitor automations for accuracy and performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement long-term fixes.

- Automation & Workflow Optimization: Identify inefficiencies in existing processes and propose smart automation solutions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand needs and build tailored workflows.

- Technical Support: Work with APIs, webhooks, and basic scripting (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL) to resolve data sync issues, system errors, and performance bottlenecks.

- Documentation & Training: Document workflows, integrations, and processes to ensure scalability. Assist in training internal users on newly built systems and automation tools.



Tools You’ll Work With:

- Automation & Integrations: Zapier, Make, Webhooks

- CRMs & Operations Tools: GoHighLevel, ClickFunnels, Stripe, ClickUp

- Collaboration Tools: Google Sheets, Zoom, Google Workspace

- Scripting & APIs: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL



Application Instructions:

Please submit your application through the online form provided: 



- To be considered, you MUST type “MAVERICK” in front of your full name if you are applying via our website: 

- If you are an Integrations Associate who takes ownership, thinks in systems, and thrives in a fast-moving, automation-driven environment, we invite you to apply.

title: Sales Representative (Financial Services)
description:
We are a growing company looking for a detail-oriented and knowledgeable Credit Rebuilding, Credit Repair, and Credit Counseling Specialist to join our team. This role focuses on helping clients understand, improve, and manage their credit profiles through accurate guidance, strategic planning, and excellent customer service.



Key Responsibilities

• Review and analyze clients’ credit reports to identify discrepancies or improvement opportunities.

• Guide clients through the process of rebuilding or repairing their credit.

• Provide personalized credit counseling and financial education.

• Communicate with credit bureaus, lenders, and financial institutions when necessary.

• Create action plans tailored to each client's credit goals.

• Track client progress and maintain accurate documentation.

• Deliver professional, compassionate support to clients navigating financial challenges.



Qualifications

• Experience in credit rebuilding, credit repair, or credit counseling is required.

• Strong understanding of credit scoring, credit laws, and financial practices.

• Excellent communication and customer service skills.

• High attention to detail and strong analytical ability.

• Ability to handle sensitive financial data with confidentiality and professionalism.

• Organized, proactive, and able to work independently.
