title: Customer Service & Sales Specialist (Google & Meta Ads Agency)
description:
Full-Time | $6.25/hour | Sales Bonuses | Long-Term | Weekdays | UK Timezone (9am–5pm)



We’re a growing performance marketing agency specialising in Meta Ads and Google Ads, working with clients directly and through Fiverr. We’re hiring a rockstar Customer Success & Sales Specialist to own customer communication end-to-end: responding fast, building trust, handling questions confidently, and converting enquiries into paying clients.



This role is for someone who enjoys talking to people, stays organised under pressure, and can move conversations forward without needing hand-holding.



**The Role (What you’ll own**



You will be the “front desk” of the business — the person who ensures:



prospects get fast, confident answers and become customers, and



existing customers feel taken care of and stay happy.



You’ll manage messaging, qualify leads, sell our services, and coordinate internally so delivery runs smoothly.



**Working Hours**



Full-time: 8 hours/day



Monday to Friday only



Must be available 9am–5pm UK time



**Responsibilities**



**Customer Communication & Support**



Respond to customer enquiries and messages (primarily Fiverr, plus other channels as needed)



Keep conversations professional, clear, and on-brand



Gather required details from customers to ensure smooth onboarding and delivery



Handle follow-ups, updates, and basic issue resolution before escalating



**Sales & Conversions**



Qualify inbound leads (understand needs, budget, timeline, urgency)



Confidently explain our service and recommend the right package



Overcome basic objections and guide prospects to purchase



Maintain strong response times and close loops (no dropped conversations)



**Operations & Internal Coordination**



Create/track tasks and updates in Notion (ticket management)



Coordinate with our internal team to ensure on-time delivery



Join quick internal calls when needed for handoffs, clarifications, or updates



**What We’re Looking For**



**Must-Haves**



- Excellent written and spoken English (this is critical)



- Strong organisation + reliability (you don’t drop balls)



- Proactive mindset: you see problems coming and fix them early



- Comfortable with customer communication and sales conversations



**Big Bonus (Preferred)**



- Google Ads experience (even basic understanding helps you sell and communicate better)



- Familiarity with Fiverr, Notion, Slack, Google Drive (we can train the right person)



**Compensation & Perks**



$6.25/hour starting rate



 - Performance bonuses (based on results: responsiveness, customer satisfaction, conversions)



- Long-term role with training, support, and room to grow into more responsibility



**How to Apply**



Important: We receive a high volume of applications. We will only respond to applicants who follow the instructions above exactly.



Please send:

 A 30-second video introducing yourself, covering:



- Your relevant experience (customer support + sales)

- Your Google Ads experience (if you have any)



We review applications carefully and will contact strong candidates for a quick intro call.

title: Expert Graphic Designer (Brand + Digital + Print Marketing Assets)
description:
Expert Graphic Designer (Brand + Digital + Print Marketing Assets)



The Role



We are looking for an expert-level Graphic Designer to take ownership of creating professional, branded marketing materials across both digital and print formats.



Your primary objective is to help strengthen our brand presence and credibility through high-quality designs that support business growth. You will be responsible for designing marketing assets that are visually consistent, polished, and aligned with our brand messaging.



This role is ideal for a designer who understands brand strategy, follows brand guidelines, and produces clean professional layouts without excessive revisions.



About Us



We are a US-based technology-related company supporting hospitality and multi-site facilities. We offer a variety of different products and services to various markets.



Responsibilities



You will be responsible for designing professional branded content including:



Digital Marketing Assets



 graphics and banners



Digital ads and promotional graphics



Branded social media templates and post layouts



Infographics and service graphics



Sales support graphics for presentations and proposals



Print Marketing Assets



Flyers, brochures, and one-pagers



Postcards and mailers



Trade show materials and promotions



Signage, booth graphics, and event collateral



Product and service marketing sheets



Brand and Design Support



Follow and apply our brand manual consistently



Maintain clean typography, spacing, and visual hierarchy



Ensure color consistency and correct file formatting



Organize and manage design files for easy team access



Help evolve brand templates for consistent future use



Competitor and Industry Research



Research competitor marketing materials and branding



Help identify how we can visually differentiate ourselves



Learn our industries, terminology, and services independently



Requirements



Expert-level graphic design skills with a strong portfolio



Strong understanding of branding, typography, layout, and color principles



Ability to design for both print and digital formats



Ability to follow brand guidelines precisely



Strong attention to detail



Excellent English reading and communication skills (using tools to proofread your work)



Ability to take ownership of deliverables and meet deadlines



Ability to research and understand B2B industries and technical terms



Required Tools



Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign)



Canva (advanced, for templates and quick content creation)



Google Drive file organization skills



Preferred Skills



Experience designing trade show and event collateral



Experience designing for B2B technology companies



Experience designing
 graphics with marketing best practices



What Success Looks Like



Your designs look professional, modern, and consistent



You deliver clean work with minimal revisions



You organize files properly and keep brand assets easy to access



You proactively suggest improvements to templates and layouts



You help strengthen brand consistency across all marketing channels



The Hiring Process



Step 1, Application

Submit your portfolio showing a variety of design work, including digital and print samples.



Step 2, Paid Test Gig

Finalists will be invited to complete a one-time paid test ($50 USD).



Test Task

We will provide a brand guide and content. You will create:



1 flyer or one-pager



1 postcard design



1 social media post template



1
 graphic



Do not apply if you are unwilling to complete a paid test.



How to Apply



Please send your application message with the subject line:

"Expert Graphic Designer - [Your Name]"



In your message, include:



A link to your portfolio (required)



Examples of print work (brochures, postcards, flyers, etc.)



Your hourly rate



Your weekly availability



A short paragraph explaining how your design work has helped improve branding, credibility, or business growth for clients



Applications without a portfolio will not be reviewed.

title: Entry-Level Healthcare Virtual Assistant (full/part-time)
description:
APPLICATION PROCESS:

1.Email us your resume in PDF format only. Include all of the jobs you've worked at and the month + year. Do not leave anything off. Do not leave anything off.  You must provide an explanation of any gaps in your work history. Include the compensation you received for each job. Do not give us your hourly pay, only your annual compensation or total compensation.  If there is any gap in your resume without an explanation of the gap, you will be disqualified.



2. Email us a 60-second video of yourself answering the following question:

What are the 3 most important things that the company you work for MUST do to show you that they care about you? For example, if they don’t give me these 3 things then that means they don’t care about me. The video CANNOT EXCEED 60 seconds, or you will automatically be disqualified.



3. IMPORTANT: Please Email us at accounts(@)achieveih.com. Failure to follow the above instructions will result in automatic disqualifications.  Do not DM us or call us or contact us in any other way.



ABOUT OUR COMPANY:

Achieve Integrative Health is the #1 rated Acupuncture & Wellness Clinic in the United States with over 750 five star google reviews. Our Mission is to help people restore their body’s God given ability to heal itself so that they can do what they love. Our vision is to equip and inspire one million people around the world to do what they love, when they want, with whom they want. 



WHY JOIN US?

• You’ll Achieve your Goals = our team provides all of the resources (information, training, opportunities) you’ll need to achieve all of your Professional, Financial and Personal Goals, as long as you are willing to put in the work and deliver results.



• Peace and Joy Team = we have a phenomenal culture of care for our patients and our team members. We are very strict with our rules, policies and core values in order to protect our culture of peace and joy.  Imagine being on a team where you don’t have to deal with people who talk behind your back and end up back stabbing you.



• Be Highly Rewarded as a Side Benefit = imagine being able to do your Passion everyday and make a phenomenal living as a side benefit. The average "experienced" VAs in the Philippines/Indonesia make $5-$7 USD/hr, our entry-level VAs start off making $5/hr. We have a quarterly bonus program, where some of our team members have earned $500-$1,000USD per quarter, and this year 2025, because the team has performed so well, some team members were paid an 'additional' year end bonus of $2000-$3000 USD.



BENEFITS

• Competitive Total Compensation = $5-$12 USD/hr for graveyard shift only.

• Unlimited Opportunities for Growth = as long as you can generate more results for the company we will never limit your ability to grow within our company. Every team member can also become a partner of the business if they desire.

• Other Benefits for qualified team members = paid-time off, premium medical insurance, Employee Savings Matching Program

• Work from Home = no more 2-4 hour commutes to work

• Wellness Initiatives = benefit from complimentary virtual health services from our medical providers, ensuring your well-being and your family’s well-being is always a priority.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

• Receive all inbound calls to close Leads wanting to receive treatments at our clinic

• Call, email, and use various communication forms to identify the validity and potential of the lead

• Receive all inbound calls to answer questions – fact find and qualify lead/route to appropriate team members

• Work with patients to ensure they are satisfied with the services provided

• Encourage happy patients to send us their success stories

• Share patient success stories during daily company meeting

• Implement our CARE system to follow-up with our patients to provide 5 star service

• Check-in and checkout patients

• Verify Insurance Benefits

• Other additional tasks may be added based on your strengths…



CHARACTER REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS

• You must truly have a caring heart and truly want to help people improve their health, if you are mainly focused on how much money you can make, we are not the team for you

• You must speak Fluent English (ie. someone on the phone can understand what you're saying w/o straining)

• You must be organized and be able to handle multiple tasks and responsibilities everyday. If you’re looking to only do one or two tasks per day, we are the wrong team for you.

• You must be able to follow instructions exactly as written, if you don’t like reading or following instructions, we are not the right team for you

• You must have a good heart. If you like to gossip behind peoples back, please don’t apply.

• You must value Results over effort. If you like to be paid based on how many tasks you completed or how much responsibilities you have, we are not the team for you. We pay ONLY based on you meeting your KPIs, metrics, quotas.

• You must sleep the same schedule 7 days a week, as this is a graveyard shift, you cannot switch back to the Philippines/Indonesian time zone on the weekends as this destroys your health. Your Health is our priority, and if you don’t value your own health we don’t want you on our team.

• You must be honest and have integrity. If you are caught lying, you will be immediately terminated.

• You must want to EARN your pay (ie. base salary + bonuses) instead of being given a pay (ie. focused only on base salary) that you didn’t earn.



WORKSTATION REQUIREMENTS

• You must have a separate quiet room to work in. You can not have your children or anybody else in the room that you work as your screen will be displaying confidential information, no exceptions.

• There can not be any background noise in your room when you are making phone calls.

• You will be required to provide photos of your workspace

• We will also randomly ask you to show your workspace via your webcam, and if you are caught lying you will be fired immediately.



COMPUTER AND INTERNET REQUIREMENTS:

• Fast and reliable wired internet connection of not less than 100 Mbps

• Secondary and Tertiary Back up Internet of not less than 10 Mbps

• At least one Power Station Backup

• Dual Monitor

• Intel Core i3 or higher Operating System with at least 8gb RAM

• Excellent quality headset with microphone, and a working webcam



WORK SCHEDULE:

OPTION 1 > Full-time 8:00 - 18:00 (M-Th) 8:00-16:00 (F) U.S. Central Standard Time, 2-hr lunch breaks 

OPTION 2 > Part-time 7:00-13:00 (M-F) U.S. Central Standard Time 

OPTION 3 > Part-time 13:00-18:30 (M-F) U.S. Central Standard Time

title: Paralegal
description:
Paralegal – Family Law Firm (Remote, Full-Time)



We are a growing family law firm seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Paralegal to join our team. This is a remote, full-time position for candidates based in the Philippines through OnlineJobs.ph.



Key Responsibilities:



Draft and prepare legal documents (motions, pleadings, discovery responses, client letters).



Conduct legal research and summarize findings for attorney review.



Manage case files and ensure all documents are organized and up to date.



Assist with e-filing of documents in U.S. courts.



Communicate with clients in a professional and compassionate manner.



Track case deadlines and maintain the attorney’s calendar.



Prepare exhibits, affidavits, and other supporting documents.



Handle administrative tasks such as scheduling, data entry, and document formatting.



Qualifications:



Prior experience as a paralegal or legal assistant (family law experience preferred).



Strong written and verbal English communication skills.



Ability to draft documents independently with high attention to detail.



Familiarity with U.S. legal procedures and e-filing (training can be provided).



Excellent organizational and time management skills.



Tech-savvy; comfortable using legal software, cloud storage, and task management tools.



Computer with at least 16GB RAM to ensure smooth performance when handling large documents and case files.



Fast and reliable internet connection, with a backup solution in case of outages.



Preferred Skills (Not Required but a Plus):



Experience with U.S. family law cases (divorce, custody, child support, adoption).



Knowledge of legal case management software (Clio, MyCase, or similar).



Experience working with international law firms remotely.



Work Schedule & Compensation:



Full-time, 40 hours per week (flexible schedule but must overlap with U.S. Central Time for at least 4 hours daily).



Competitive salary based on experience (paid in USD via OnlineJobs.ph).



Opportunities for long-term employment and career growth.



How to Apply:



Submit your resume and cover letter.



Include a brief video (2–3 minutes) introducing yourself and explaining your experience as a paralegal.



Provide samples of legal documents you have drafted (if available).

title: Legal Assistant / Paralegal – Remote, U.S. Law Firm (Full-Time
description:
Legal Assistant / Paralegal – Remote, U.S. Law Firm (Full-Time)



Work Hours: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM Central Time (U.S.)

Location: Remote – Must Have Strong Spoken English and American Accent

We are a busy U.S.-based law firm seeking a Legal Assistant / Paralegal who can also cover receptionist duties. This role requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to perform substantive legal support work in addition to handling client intake and scheduling.





Requirements (Must-Have – No Exceptions)

American accent and fluent spoken and written English

Strong grammar and writing proficiency

Experience using Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, Excel)

Computer with at least 16GB of RAM

Stable internet connection (minimum 100 Mbps download speed) with backup access in the event of power outages

USB headset with clear microphone

Availability to work 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM Central Time (U.S.)

Quiet, distraction-free home office

Prior law firm or legal support experience strongly preferred



Responsibilities



Receptionist Duties:

Answer and direct incoming calls professionally

Respond to form submissions and online inquiries promptly

Schedule consultations and meetings for attorneys

Update CRM with accurate lead and client information



Legal Assistant / Paralegal Duties:

Draft, proofread, and format legal documents, pleadings, discovery requests/responses, contracts, and correspondence under attorney supervision

Organize, index, and maintain case files (both physical and electronic)

Conduct factual and legal research using online databases and public records

Prepare exhibits, trial binders, and hearing materials

Track and manage court deadlines, hearings, and filing requirements to ensure compliance

File legal documents with courts via e-filing systems

Summarize depositions, discovery responses, and other legal documents for attorney review

Assist in preparing immigration, family law, or civil litigation case packets as assigned

Manage billing entries, timesheets, and expense records





The Ideal Candidate Would Also Have:

A Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Paralegal Studies, Communications, Law)

Paralegal certificate or equivalent training/experience

Familiarity with legal software such as Clio, MyCase, or Lawmatics

Ability to work independently and prioritize competing deadlines

Important Application Note



Applications will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, so please do not be discouraged from applying if you do not meet every single requirement listed. Pay can be negotiated depending on experience, skills, and qualifications.





How to Apply

Interested applicants must send a Google Drive link containing the following:

Your updated resume

A 1–2 minute video recording introducing yourself, demonstrating your spoken English, and explaining why you are a good fit for the role (upload the file to Google Drive and set to “Anyone with the link can view”)

A short written paragraph (3–5 sentences) explaining your relevant experience

Important: Include the codeword “milo47” in your
 subject or the first sentence so we know you read the full job post.

Applications that do not include all the above items will not be considered.

title: Recruiter Specialist
description:
Job Title: Recruiter Specialist (Full-Time, Remote)



Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-Time (9 hours/day)



Company Overview:



We are a fast-growing college counseling company that helps students from 8th–12th grade become standout applicants for top universities. Our team supports families through college candidacy development, passion project guidance, and the full college application process. We prioritize excellence, compassion, and a high standard of care in everything we do.



Position Overview:



We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Recruiter to help us source, evaluate, and onboard exceptional talent across roles such as College Counselors, Passion Project Mentors, Student Success tea
mbers, Research Leads, and more.



This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, has strong people instincts, and can manage end-to-end recruiting independently.



Key Responsibilities:



• Manage full-cycle recruiting: sourcing, screening, and coordinating final steps with leadership.

• Build and maintain strong pipelines for key roles (e.g., college counselors, mentors, operations, success staff).

• Conduct structured interviews and evaluate candidate fit based on company values, communication ability, experience, and alignment with our mission.

• Coordinate with leadership to understand hiring needs and refine role descriptions as needed.

• Own job postings across platforms (LinkedIn, Indeed, etc.) and ensure candidates receive timely communication.

• Manage Calendly scheduling, follow-ups, and status updates for all active candidates.

• Support the onboarding process by ensuring new hires have the right documentation, access, and first-week clarity.

• Maintain organized candidate records and notes to ensure smooth handoffs to the Success Team or Founder.

• Contribute to a positive candidate experience through warm, clear, and professional communication.



Qualifications:



• Strong interpersonal skills, you’re comfortable speaking with candidates, asking thoughtful questions, and representing the company with professionalism.

• Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple roles, candidates, and timelines simultaneously.

• Experience in recruiting, HR, or talent acquisition is a strong plus (agency or in-house).

• Strong writing and communication skills.

• Ability to work independently in a remote environment and take ownership of processes.

• Mission-driven and aligned with supporting students and families.



What We Offer:



• Fully remote role

• Fast-growing team with meaningful impact

• Flexible PTO

• Opportunity to grow into broader HR, operations, or team-lead roles as the company expands

title: Project coordinator
description:
Project Coordinator (Service + Production Operations) — Job Description

Department: Operations / Administration

Employment Type: Full-time (Ontario)

 (occasional early/late coverage during peak season, storms, emergencies)

Location: Remote Online

Tools: JobTread, Microsoft 365, CompanyCam, QuickBooks sync, WhatsApp, SiteDocs/JotForm (as needed)



Job Summary

The Project Coordinator is Sellax Roofing’s Operations Control Tower—the primary point of coordination between clients, crews, subcontractors, vendors, sales, accounting, and leadership. You manage the daily flow of service and production work so jobs move cleanly from intake ? authorization ? scheduling ? dispatch ? execution ? documentation ? closeout report ? invoicing ? collections support.



This role is built for a strong independent operator: someone who can manage multiple jobs at once, solve problems in real time, and keep clients informed without constant direction.





Key Responsibilities

Customer Service & Communication (30–35%)

• Answer incoming calls/emails/texts professionally and promptly.

• Triage requests (leak/emergency vs. scheduled service vs. inspection vs maintenance vs production support).

• Confirm appointment windows, expectations, and job readiness requirements.

• Provide proactive updates (confirmations, ETAs, delays/reschedules, multi-day progress updates).

• Document customer communication and commitments clearly.

• Escalate immediately to leadership for safety risks, critical assets impacted (IT/electrical), legal threats, or repeat failure/callback patterns.

Intake + Scheduling & Dispatch Support (25–30%)

• Schedule service calls, inspections, maintenance/RTM, snow/ice, and production start readiness.

• Optimize routes by geography and protect capacity with buffer time.

• Review schedule/dispatch queue multiple times daily and manage due dates 48 hours ahead.

• Dispatch crews/subs with a clear job brief: scope, access, contacts, priority, and photo requirements.

• Coordinate same-day changes due to emergencies, weather, access issues, or material delays.

Work Authorization + Job Readiness Control (10–15%)

• Ensure required Work Authorization is approved before dispatch (unless leadership exception).

• Confirm billing rules: PO requirements, approval contacts, invoice recipient, job limits (NTE if used).

• Ensure access and safety readiness: roof access method, sign-in/security rules, escorts, PPE requirements.

• Maintain a “dispatch-ready” standard—no crew rolls without complete site, access, scope, and contact information.

Crew / Vendor / Subcontractor Coordination (15–20%)

• Crews: confirm daily readiness (access, materials/equipment, safety needs, targets, documentation requirements).

• Crews: remove blockers in real time (weather, access, missing materials, client changes).

• Crews: enforce same-day field updates (status, notes, photos,
).

• Vendors & equipment: coordinate deliveries, pickup/returns, substitutions, shortages, and equipment rentals (lifts/cranes).

• Subcontractors: schedule subs, confirm scope/timeline, collect compliance documents (WSIB, COIs, agreements).

• Subcontractors: ensure work is documented and invoices match approved scope/PO before forwarding to accounting.

Administrative Documentation + Reporting (10–15%)

• Maintain complete job files: photos, notes, work details, approvals, compliance documents.

• Produce weekly summaries: backlog health, leak SLA performance, schedule vs. completion, invoice readiness, red-flag accounts.

• Maintain clean organization standards for digital files and job attachments.

Job Closeout + Client Reporting (Quality Gate) (10–15%)

• Review completed work for clarity and completeness before closeout.

• Create a client-facing closeout report from crew information: work performed, findings, before/after photos, materials used, recommendations/next steps.

• Ensure every job is client-ready (understandable) and invoice-ready (complete backup).

Invoicing + Billing Support + AR Coordination (10–15%)

• Create and send invoices based on completed work and approved documentation.

• Verify invoice accuracy (scope line items, labor/materials, photos/closeout report, PO reference if required).

• Target invoice turnaround: within 48 hours of job completion (service).

• Support AR follow-up: send reminders, document attempts, flag aging accounts, escalate red flags.

• Controls: payment releases, payroll release, credit holds, and major credits/adjustments require GM/Accounting approval.

Materials, Equipment & Inventory Tracking (Ongoing)

• Track materials/equipment by job: ordered, delivered, used, returned.

• Maintain simple shop + truck stock control for key items (top 30–50 SKUs).

• Trigger restocks, track stock-outs/returns/shrink, and report variances.

• Ensure inventory purchases are coded correctly (job vs. stock).

Additional Duties / Special Projects (As Needed)

• Assist with process improvements, templates/checklists, seasonal readiness, and reporting upgrades.

• Support internal initiatives and provide coverage during peak periods or emergencies.

• Other tasks as assigned by leadership to support operations growth.

Success Metrics (KPIs)

• Backlog ? 75% monthly goal.

• 95% leak calls scheduled within 72 hours.

• 90%+ ETA compliance; 100% ETA changes communicated/logged.

• Invoice speed: 48-hour average from completion ? invoice sent.

• Job file completeness: 95%+ photos/notes/status/backup.

• Invoice accuracy:

title: Enterprise Account Executive
description:
Role Overview

We are seeking an experienced Enterprise Account Executive to drive revenue growth by managing enterprise client relationships, identifying new business opportunities, and closing high-value SaaS deals. This role requires strong consultative selling skills, pipeline management, and the ability to manage complex, multi-stakeholder sales cycles.

 

Key Responsibilities

Client Acquisition & Retention

• Identify and engage enterprise prospects to expand the customer base

• Build and maintain long-term relationships with existing clients

Sales Strategy & Execution

• Execute sales strategies to meet or exceed revenue targets

• Conduct market and account research to understand customer needs

Pipeline Management

• Own the full sales cycle: prospecting, qualification, proposal, negotiation, and close

• Maintain accurate pipeline and forecasting data in CRM (HubSpot or similar)

Solution Selling

• Understand client business challenges and position Allyable’s platform as the solution

• Deliver product demos and enterprise-level presentations

Collaboration

• Share market feedback and competitive insights internally

Negotiation & Closing

• Prepare proposals, negotiate contracts, and close deals

• Ensure contracts align with company policies and client expectations

 

Required Qualifications

• 3+ years full-cycle sales experience in SaaS / Cloud / Enterprise software

• Proven ability to consistently hit quota (USD $500k+ annually preferred)

• Strong experience managing complex pipelines and long sales cycles

• Excellent negotiation and closing skills

• Experience using HubSpot or similar CRM

• Ability to manage multiple opportunities simultaneously

• Startup experience is a plus

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

• Fluent in English (additional languages are a plus)

 

Nice to Have / Advantages

• AI or web accessibility industry exposure

• Experience selling into healthcare, retail, insurance, finance, or tech

• Technical background or familiarity with web technologies

• Multilingual

title: Personal Executive Assistant
description:
I’m looking for a high-level Personal Executive Assistant to work directly with me as my right hand. This is not a basic admin job. You will operate closely with me day-to-day helping manage my calendar, priorities, communication, projects, and personal logistics as we continue scaling fast.



I’m the co-founder of BookDrop, a rapidly growing bulk book logistics and resale company. Our environment moves quickly. I need someone who is organized, proactive, warm in communication, and genuinely excited to be all-in supporting a growing company and executive.



This is a full-time remote role based in the Philippines working Arizona hours (7:00 AM – 4:00 PM).



WHAT YOU’LL DO

• Act as my right-hand partner in daily execution and organization

• Manage calendar, scheduling, reminders, and priorities

• Organize communication, follow-ups, and task tracking

• Support operations, growth projects, and leadership workflows

• Build clean systems in Google Sheets and other tools

• Help reduce noise so I can stay focused on high-level work



This role requires initiative. You don’t wait to be told every step. You think ahead, bring solutions, and stay steady even when things move fast.



REQUIRED SKILLS

• Advanced Google Sheets skills

• Strong English communication (written and spoken)

• Highly organized and comfortable juggling priorities

• Tech-savvy and quick to learn new tools

• Reliable internet and ability to work US hours

• Comfortable using TimeDoctor



PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

• Supporting founders or C-level leaders

• Project management or workflow systems

• Automation, systems thinking, or light tech skills



WHO THRIVES HERE

• Organized but adaptable

• Positive, warm, and confident communicator

• Calm under pressure with high standards

• Independent thinker who enjoys close collaboration

• Someone excited to be fully invested and grow long-term in a right-hand role



HOW TO APPLY

Send your resume to 
 and include a ~2-minute video covering:

• Why you believe you’re a strong fit

• Be camera ready with a warm positive personality





Applications without both a resume and video will not be reviewed.

title: Accounting Specialist with US Real Estate Experience
description:
EJF Real Estate is a well-established, rapidly growing residential real estate company in the District of Columbia is seeking to hire an experienced Accounting Specialist who is responsible, organized, detail oriented, and reliable to join our fun/hard working team. You must have excellent communication skills.



Job purpose:

The Accounting Specialist (AS) will work directly with the Director of Corporate Accounting (DCA) to maintain the accounts for numerous companies. The AS is responsible for downloading and posting all daily bank account transactions and properly coding the transactions. The AS will maintain all GL accounts and the chart of accounts. This position requires an extremely detail orientated person with significant knowledge of accounting, bookkeeping, and Quickbooks.



Duties & Responsibilities:

- Daily activities include maintaining bank feeds between various banks and their respective accounts in Quickbooks. Once downloaded, the AS will code transactions to the proper GL to ensure accurate accounting.

- The AS will be responsible for maintaining rules for transactions and other methods of creating efficiencies for posting a large batch of transactions each day.

- Weekly activities will include posting invoices, creating invoices, posting payments, and making deposits.

- Monthly activities include bank reconciliation, ledger tie outs, journal entry postings, inter-company billing, and performing other duties to close the books each month.

- Analyze financial results and post information into monthly reports for the Executive Team.

- Manage regular preparation of relevant management reports, including weekly, monthly, quarterly and year-end reports.

- Performs various journal entries, account reconciliations, and provides general ledger support.

- Helps in the preparation of the annual budget for multiple companies.

- Support the DCA in the administration and preparation of information for opening and closing bank accounts.

- Will be part of the Financial Team and work collaboratively with tea
mbers. Attend required weekly meeting and participate by setting goals and completing assigned tasks.

- Prepare written reports to accompany financial data.

- Must be able to analyze data, problems, and issues, formulate solutions, and execute the resolutions. The AS must have at least an intermediate understanding of accounting principles.

- Willing to learn new software.

- Performs other duties as assigned.



Qualification:

- Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business Administration, Human Resources or related field required.

- 3-5 years of accounting/analyst experience is REQUIRED..

- Extensive knowledge of accounting principles.

- MUST be highly proficient in Excel.

- MUST be fluent in English and have excellent writing skills.



Preferred Education and Experience:

- Proficient at Microsoft Office Suite and specifically Excel.

- Proficient in Quickbooks.

- Must be well organized and a self-starter.

- Detail oriented, professional attitude, reliable.

- Possess strong organizational and time management skills.

- Strong problem-solving skills, accounting principles knowledge, documentation. skills, research and resolution skills, data analysis and multi-tasking skills.

- Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing.

- Ability to interact with employees and vendors in a professional manner.

- Ability to work independently and with a team in a fast-paced and high-volume environment with emphasis on accuracy and timeliness.



Working conditions:

- Full remote work (work anywhere).

- Work schedule is Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM Eastern Standard Time (EST) including the 30 minutes unpaid meal break.

- Acceptance of using time-tracking device installed in your computer while rendering service with EJF Real Estate Services.



How to apply:

1. Send me an
 attachment with your updated resume in PDF format.

2. Please send me a link to your voice recording introducing yourself & your relevant experience and include your OnlineJobs.PH profile link.

3. Kindly send your application to 
 and 
 the subject line, kindly indicate the position Accounting Specialist - your name.



*Applicants who will not follow instructions will be automatically rejected without notice.

* Shortlisted applicants will be contacted by
 for interview scheduling.

Looking forward to working with you!

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
Position Summary



We are seeking an experienced Operations Supervisor to support day-to-day patient support and provider operations while leading front-line team performance. This role is ideal for someone with strong healthcare BPO experience who is comfortable managing performance, coaching tea
mbers, and ensuring high-quality patient and provider support outcomes.



This role partners closely with the Operations Manager and serves as a key driver of team execution, service quality, and operational consistency.



Key Responsibilities

Team Supervision and Performance Management



• Provide day-to-day supervision, coaching, and performance management for patient support and operations tea
mbers

• Monitor productivity, quality, and service metrics and address performance gaps proactively

• Conduct performance conversations, coaching sessions, and performance improvement planning as needed

• Support onboarding, training reinforcement, and ongoing skill development

• Partner with the Operations Manager on workforce planning, performance trends, and process improvement opportunities



Patient Support Operations



• Support inbound and outbound patient communication workflows, including inquiries, follow-ups, and appointment reminders

• Ensure patient concerns are handled with professionalism, empathy, and urgency

• Escalate complex patient situations appropriately and support resolution



Provider Support and Scheduling



• Oversee provider scheduling workflows to ensure accuracy and efficiency

• Support providers with administrative coordination and patient record updates

• Ensure scheduling standards and service levels are consistently met



Data, Documentation, and Compliance



• Ensure accurate patient records are maintained in healthcare management systems

• Monitor documentation quality and data accuracy across the team

• Ensure compliance with HIPAA and internal privacy and security standards



Required Qualifications



• Prior healthcare operations or healthcare BPO experience

• Minimum 5 years of team lead, supervisory, or people leadership experience

• Experience managing performance issues, coaching, and performance improvement plans

• Strong communication, patient service, and stakeholder support skills

• High attention to detail and documentation accuracy

• Experience working in regulated or compliance-driven environments, HIPAA compliant



Preferred Qualifications



• Experience working in a high-volume BPO or shared services environment

• Experience supporting multi-provider or multi-location healthcare operations

• Experience with workforce metrics, quality monitoring, and performance reporting

title: Social Media Manager
description:
About Us

We are a 7-figure eCommerce company managing multiple successful consumer brands across the European market. Our mission is to build memorable brand experiences and drive meaningful customer engagement through high-impact marketing and storytelling. As we continue to scale, we are looking for a creative and strategic Social Media Manager to lead and execute organic content and engagement strategies across Pinterest, YouTube, Instagram, and
 for our brands.



Role Overview

The Social Media Manager will be responsible for developing, executing, and optimizing the organic social media strategy across Pinterest, Instagram,
, and YouTube. You will ensure our brands maintain a strong, consistent, and engaging presence across all platforms, tailored specifically to European audiences.



This role combines strategy, creativity, and execution—covering content planning, visual direction, community engagement, and performance analysis.



Key Responsibilities

Strategy & Content Planning

Develop platform-specific organic strategies for Pinterest, YouTube, Instagram, and

Create and manage monthly content calendars aligned with campaigns, seasonal trends, and product launches

Collaborate closely with designers, video editors, and copywriters to produce high-quality, on-brand content



Content Management

Plan, create, and publish engaging posts, reels, pins, stories, and short-form videos

Optimize content formats, captions, and posting schedules based on platform best practices

Maintain a consistent brand voice and visual identity across our brands



Pinterest

Create and schedule high-performing static and video pins

Optimize pin design and copy for engagement, reach, and traffic generation

Analyze Pinterest analytics to continuously improve performance and strategy



Instagram &

Make engaging reels and posts using Canva/photoshop

Plan and publish feed posts, carousels, stories, and reels

Actively engage with the community through comments, DMs, and tagged content





Analytics & Reporting

Track KPIs and performance metrics using native platform tools and reporting dashboards

Deliver clear monthly performance insights with data-driven optimization recommendations

Stay up to date with platform updates, algorithm changes, and emerging content trends



How to Apply

Please include the code SOCIAL2025 in your subject line or application message with your previous instagram accounts managed and content(reels, posts) created.

Applications without this code will not be considered.

title: Urgent Recruiter – Cold Calling Setup
description:
Job Title: Recruiter – Cold Calling Setup

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Overview:

We are seeking a highly motivated and goal-driven Recruiter with a strong background in cold calling to join our growing recruitment team. The ideal candidate will be comfortable initiating conversations with potential candidates via phone, qualifying leads, and effectively communicating job opportunities. This role plays a crucial part in building a strong candidate pipeline and ensuring a seamless recruitment process.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities:

• Proactively source candidates through cold calling, online job platforms, databases, and other recruitment channels.

• Conduct initial phone screenings to assess candidates' qualifications, interest level, and availability.

• Educate and inform candidates about job opportunities, company culture, and next steps in the hiring process.

• Maintain accurate records and candidate information using recruitment platforms (e.g., Ricochet, ATS).

• Coordinate and schedule interviews in alignment with hiring managers' availability.

• Follow up with no-show candidates and reschedule when necessary.

• Collaborate with the recruitment and training teams to ensure seamless onboarding.

• Provide regular reports and updates on candidate pipelines and recruitment activity.

• Mange client’s Indeed and set appointment using Calendly

________________________________________

Qualifications:

• Proven experience in recruitment, telesales, or outbound calling is preferred.

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

• Comfortable making a high volume of outbound calls daily.

• Strong organizational and time-management abilities.

• Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) or CRM tools is a plus.

• Ability to work independently and as part of a remote team.

• High level of integrity and professionalism.

________________________________________

What We Offer:

• Competitive compensation and performance-based incentives

• Full Remote Set-up

• Opportunities for career growth and development

• Supportive and collaborative team environment

• Training and resources to support your success

title: Patient Care Coordinator
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Remote Patient Services Representative based in the Philippines. The ideal candidate will manage inbound and outbound calls, assist patients with scheduling appointments, address inquiries, and perform other related tasks to ensure a seamless patient experience.



Key Responsibilities:

• Answer incoming calls promptly and professionally.

• Schedule, reschedule, and confirm patient appointments using our electronic health record (EHR) system.

• Provide accurate information regarding services, insurance, and payment options.

• Address patient inquiries and concerns with empathy and efficiency.

• Maintain and update patient records with a high degree of accuracy.

• Collaborate with the optometry team to ensure optimal patient care.



Performance Metrics:

To ensure excellence in patient service, the following performance metrics will be used to evaluate success in this role:

• Average Handle Time (AHT): The average duration of a patient interaction, including talk time, hold time, and after-call work. Efficiently managing AHT ensures timely assistance to patients while maintaining service quality. ?

• Quality Score: Assessment of call quality based on adherence to protocols, accuracy of information provided, and overall patient interaction effectiveness. High-quality scores reflect a commitment to excellence in patient care.

• Patient Satisfaction Score: A measure of patient contentment with the service provided, often gathered through post-interaction surveys. High scores indicate successful patient engagement and issue resolution.

• Service Level: The percentage of calls answered within a specified timeframe, reflecting the ability to meet patient demand promptly. Maintaining a high service level ensures patient satisfaction and loyalty. ?

• Appointment Scheduling Rate: The efficiency and accuracy in scheduling patient appointments, ensuring optimal utilization of clinic time and resources.



Qualifications:

• Proven experience in a customer service role, preferably in a medical or optometry setting.

• Exceptional verbal and written English communication skills.

• Familiarity with EHR systems and medical scheduling software is a plus.

• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

• Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.

• Stable internet connection and a quiet workspace conducive to professional phone conversations.



Work Schedule:

• Full-time position.

• Must be available to work U.S. business hours, including potential evening shifts to accommodate different time zones.

title: Google Ads Expert (Remote | Multi-Location Chiropractic Practice)
description:
Contract | Flat Fee: $250/month | Remote



Impact Chiropractic is a growing, multi-location family chiropractic practice with locations in Golden, Denver and Fort Collins, Colorado. We are seeking an experienced Google Ads expert to manage and optimize paid search performance across three clinic locations.



This is a remote, contract role ideal for someone who values clean systems, clear reporting, and measurable results.



Your Responsibilities

- Set up, manage, and optimize Google Ads (AdWords) campaigns for 3 locations

- Manage and optimize Google Local Services Ads (LSA)

- Configure and maintain Google Analytics and conversion tracking (calls, forms, bookings)

- Optimize ad budgets to improve lead quality and cost per lead

- Track and analyze performance metrics across all locations

- Provide monthly performance reports with insights and recommendations

- Manage and optimize Google My Business profiles for each clinic

- Implement local SEO best practices and provide website SEO recommendations

- Continuously test keywords, ads, audiences, and negative keywords

- Proven experience managing local, service-based businesses

-> Multi-location account structure

-> Conversion tracking & attribution

-> Budget optimization and scaling

-> Google Ads and LSA policy compliance

- Experience managing multiple locations under one brand



What Success Looks Like

- Clean, well-structured ad accounts

- Efficient use of ad spend aligned with business goals

description:

title: Accounting Manager, US Property Management  (Remote)
description:
About Us

Streamline Property Management is one the largest and fastest-growing  professional property management firms located in the Washington DC area. We manage over 1,000 residential properties, delivering a seamless experience for both owners and tenants. As a fast-growing, entrepreneurial company, we move quickly and value tea
mbers who take initiative. We don’t just manage properties; we manage our clients' most valuable assets, and we pride ourselves on financial precision and transparency.



About the Role:

We are seeking a meticulous Accounting Manager to own the financial integrity of our residential portfolio. This is a specialized Trust Accounting role. You will be the guardian of funds belonging to owners and tenants, ensuring 100% compliance with state regulations and company standards. 

The Accounting Manager will be responsible for the financial integrity and reporting of the residential portfolio that Streamline manages on behalf of its owners. This role focuses on ‘Trust Accounting’ - the management of funds belonging to others (owners and tenants) and ensuring compliance with state real estate regulations and company standards.

Key Responsibilities:

Property Management Accounting 

- Owner Distributions: Execute monthly owner payment cycles. Verify clearing status, run financial diagnostics, calculate management fees, and execute ACH payouts. via AppFolio.

- Bank Reconciliations: Perform monthly three-way reconciliations between the bank balance, the software book balance, and the individual property ledgers.

- Closing the Month: Ensure all AppFolio diagnostics are cleared and books are "clean" before the new cycle begins.

- Tenant and Owner Transactions: Oversee security deposit refunds, move-out accounting, and daily ledger adjustments (move-ins, chargebacks, etc.).

- Process Security Deposit refunds and move-out accounting for tenants.

- Oversee Bookkeeping team to ensure invoices are entered correctly.



Process Management & Reporting:

- Improve upon and develop new processes to improve accounting and bookkeeping at the company with an eye to automate processes and use best practices from Appfolio and other companies

- Serve as the technical point of contact for complex owner statement inquiries.

- Empower Property Managers by providing clear financial context for client-facing discussions.

- Year-End Reporting: Prepare and distribute 1099s to vendors and owners; provide year-end financial packages for tax purposes.



Requirements:

- 3+ years experience in Accounting with minimum 2+ years in Residential Property Management accounting. Candidates with no prior experience in property management will not be considered

- Expert in AppFolio or Buildium - You should know the shortcuts, the reports, and the common pitfalls

- Strong understanding of Trust accounting principles

- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

- Fluent English, great written and verbal communication

- Self-starter and organizational skills



Compensation & Schedule

- Full-time, 40 hours per week, remote contractor position

- Opportunity to grow with a stable, expanding US-based company.

- Must be available to work US Eastern Time hours



Perks & Benefits

- Paid local public holidays (12+ days per year, depending on the official calendar)

- 15 paid vacation days annually (with potential to increase based on tenure)

- Opportunities for growth in both pay and responsibilities

- Be part of a supportive and friendly small team

- Stability and consistency - we are a long-term employer

- Work remotely from the comfort of your home
salary: Salary of US $10 to $15 per hour

title: Experienced Trademark Docket Paralegal
description:
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED



R.J. Pierce Law Group, P.C. is looking for a skilled Trademark Docket Paralegal to join our growing firm! As a member of the R.J. Pierce law team, you will be an essential part of the overall operational strategy that drives our business forward.



As a Trademark Docket Paralegal for our firm, you will work under the direction of a supervising attorney and will assist in the administration of trademarks, managing client trademark case files, filing trademarks, and conducting research on behalf of the trademark attorneys. Our paralegals interact regularly with firm attorneys, contractors, and clients.



ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Monitors, reviews, and extracts information from USPTO

Identifies and communicates pertinent deadlines to lawyers, paralegals, and clients on a daily basis

Works with our attorneys and paralegals to ensure all deadlines are satisfied by assessing correspondence and proof of filings.

Programs, runs, prints, and distributes docket reports to attorneys and staff.

Prepare and distribute docket reports as requested by attorneys and legal teams to ensure that all deadlines are met. Maintain direct contact with attorneys, paralegals, and clients to ensure daily docket deadlines are satisfied.

Preserve and audit the docket database, including entering, clearing and updating filing due dates and reminders.

Notify clients of the status of their trademarks

Maintain a thorough knowledge of the docket database to create specialized reports and make appropriate changes as necessary.

Auditing trademark files on the docket and updating our CRM system

Coordinate client communications and create automations in our CRM system

Maintain knowledge of trends, developments, and legislative rulings impacting all IP procedures and regulations.

Assisting the legal team with conducting and analyzing trademark clearance searches; retrieving, analyzing, and reporting the status of registrations and performing other tasks as necessary relating to the administering of the trademark process, when necessary

Create Trademark opinion letters that include legal analysis, advice, and recommendations on whether a proposed trademark is available to use and/or register

Manage multiple client-facing databases containing pending and completed matters for each client

Assist with the preparation, filing, and maintenance of trademark applications at the USPTO

Organize, maintain, and update files and docket information related to clients' trademark status

Write Cease-and-Desist letters

Create automations within our CRM

All other tasks as assigned





EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS REQUIRED:

Experience with a US trademark filing or familiarity with electronic filing with the USPTO is REQUIRED

Docketing experience REQUIRED

Associate's degree or certificate in paralegal studies preferred but not required (Years of experience will be taken into account in the absence of formal education.)

2-3 years of experience as a paralegal in the Trademark Law industry preferred

Proficiency in MS Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint

Candidates must possess strong communication, organization, research, writing, and analytical skills.

Ability to work and communicate with a team in an online collaboration platform.

Strong listening and interpersonal skills

Ability to work on several initiatives simultaneously within compressed time frames, while still maintaining effectiveness

Must have proficient computer and technical skills

Must be detail-oriented and have the ability to prioritize and work proactively with minimal supervision in a fast-paced, deadline-driven work environment

Effective rapport-building and relationship management skills

Demonstrated ability to be resourceful, innovative, and creative

Demonstrates high emotional intelligence and problem-solving skills

Must be team-oriented, possess a positive attitude, and work well with others





PLEASE MESSAGE ME WITH A LINK TO YOUR RESUME.
